loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат трудолюбивый и добрый молодой человек, он холост. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием лука и ячменя. Имеет 2,5 гектаров земли для посева. Он усердно работает, чтобы продвигаться вперед и стать успешным дехканином. Данный момент его земля нуждается в обработке, чтобы получить хороший урожай. С этой целью Шухрат запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a hard working and good young man, he is single. He has been engaged in growing onions and barley for more than 10 years. He has 2.5 hectares of land for sowing. He works diligently, in order to move forward and become a successful farmer. 

Currently Shuhrat's land needs processing, in order for him to receive a good harvest. With this Aim, Shuhrat requests a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He hopes for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин имеет дружную семью, в семье живет он, жена и его трое дети. Более 5 лет он занимается выращиванием лука, ячменя и огурцов. Имеет поливные земли в размере 1,65 гектаров. Камолиддин хочет получить хороший урожай и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 1500 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Kamoliddin  has a happy family, which includes himself, his wife, and their three children. He has been engaged in growing onions, barley and cucumbers for more than five years. He owns irrigated land 1.65 hectares. 

Kamoliddin wants to get a good harvest, and receive a good income. With this aim he requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gioconda Mariela

texts.es:
Gioconda tiene 38 años, habita en la ciudad de Libertad junto a su familia. Su casa está ubicada en el barrio Eugenio Espejo en donde tiene la despensa llamada el Chino. 
El negocio lo empezó luego de tener a su 1 hijo al separarse de su esposo. Como no contaba con ningún apoyo y el poco capital que tenía puso una pequeña tienda en su domicilio. Ella nos comenta que fue de gran ayuda ya que podía cuidar a sus hijos sin problemas. De esos inicios han pasado 6 años en los cuales poco a poco y con la experiencia adquirida su negocio ha crecido. Hoy en día Gioconda tiene una despensa muy surtida la cual atiende todos los días sin horario definido. La mayor dificultad que presenta es cuando sus hijos se enferman, como no tiene ayuda debe cerrar el negocio por lo pierde de vender. Ella es madre soltera de 2 hermoso niños de 6 y un año de edad. El crédito que solicita de conseguirlo lo empleara en la compra de arroz, papelería, azúcar y otros productos de consumo diario. Hasta el momento su negocio le a dado buenos resultados y espera continuar así por mucho tiempo. Su sueño como toda madre es ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad.
texts.en:
Giaoconda is thirty-eight years old and lives with her family in the city of Libertad. Her house is located in the Eugenio Espejo neighborhood, where she has a general store called "el Chino."

She started the business after having her first child and separating from her husband. Since she didn't have any support, she put what little capital she had into a little store in her home. She tells us that it was a huge help since she could take care of her children without any problems. From these beginnings they have passed six years during which time, little by little, and with the experience she has acquired, her business has grown. Today, Gioconda has a very well stocked grocery store which she tends every day of the week without a set schedule. 

The main difficulty that presents itself is that when her children get sick, since she doesn't have help, she has to close the business and so loses sales. She is a single mother of two handsome children of six and one years of age. On receiving the loan that she has requested she will use it to purchase rice, stationery, sugar, and other products of daily consumption. As of the moment, her business has given her good results and she hopes to continue in this way for a long time. Her dream, like all mothers, is to see her children graduate university.

loans.use: to buy rice, stationery, sugar

loans.name: Utkirboi

texts.ru: Уткирбой трудолюбивый и заботливый семьянин, ему 30 года, женат и любящий отец троих детей. У него большая и дружная семья, в семье работает только Уткирбой. Жена занимается домохозяйством  и присматривает за детьми. Более 10 лет занимается выращиванием лука и ячменя на площади 0,60 гектаров земли. Он также занимается скотоводством. Уткирбой хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли и скота с целью увеличения их поголовье. Уткирбой надеется на вашу помощь, которая позволит ему улучшить его благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Utkirboi is a hard working and diligent family man. He is 30 years old, married, and the loving father of three children. He has a very happy family, and in this family only Utkirboi works. His wife is a housewife and she looks after the children. 

Utkirboi has been engaged in growing onions and barley at a plot of land of 0.60 hectares for more than 10 years. He further works with livestock breeding. Utkirboi would like to receive this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers for the cultivation of land and for the purchase of cattle, with an aim to increase their number. Utkirboi hopes for your help, which will allow him to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase of cattle and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kishimjan

texts.ru:
Кишимжан 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Кишимжан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 25 лет назад начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 16,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Кишимжан имеется 1 корова с теленком, 15 овец и 2,20 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и перец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кишимжан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян.  Доходы от кредита Кишимжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kishimjan is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. As the main income for her family, Kishimjan started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding 25 years ago, after having started the business with an amount of 16,000 som (KGS). Currently Kishimjan's farm has one cow and one calf, 15 sheep, and 2.2 hectares of land, where she grows beans and peppers. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kishimjan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds. Kishimjan plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 36 años, está casada con Juan desde hace 18 años. Tienen tres hijos: Rudy, Rene y Ángela, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio de Chilca. 
Para el futuro de sus hijos, ella ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. “Los dos tenemos que trabajar porque no alcanza el dinero”, menciona. Ese problema no la asusta, al contrario le da fuerzas para seguir trabajando. Comenzó hace algunos años en la compra y venta de granos verdes y verduras, en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad y también en la capital del país. A su vez, los dos se dedican a la siembra de papa, olluco, maíz y otros tubérculos, en los terrenos agrícolas que tienen en otra ciudad, a donde viajan cada vez que pueden. Asimismo, su esposo trabaja como albañil en construcción de casas, según cuenta percibe una ganancia promedio de 1500 soles mensuales, “todo depende de los contratos”, menciona.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a sus compañeros que son personas solidarias y responsables.
Carmen invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de papa y otros tubérculos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
36-year old Carmen has been married to Juan for eighteen years. They have three children, Rudy, Rene, and Angela, and live in their own house in the Chilca neighbourhood. To ensure a good future for their children, Carmen helps her husband with household expenses. “We both have to work,” she says, “or we wouldn’t have enough money.”

This problem doesn’t scare her at all; on the contrary, it makes her keen to carry on working. Some years ago she started buying and selling grain and vegetables in the local wholesale market and also in the market of the capital city. As well, Carmen and Juan grow potatoes, olluco, maize, and other root crops on agricultural land which they own in another town. They go there whenever they have the time. Juan also works in housing construction as a bricklayer. He earns an average of 1500 soles a month, but as he says, “all depends on contracts”. 

This is Carmen’s sixth loan with MFP. She is pleased with the support she receives and is grateful for the confidence shown in her. She promises to make the repayments on time because she doesn’t wish to let down her companions who are committed, responsible people.

Carmen will use the loan money to buy several sacks of potatoes and other tubers for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and other tubers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 48 años, está casada con Fredy hace 23 años y tienen dos hijos: Cristian y Maciel.
Su principal actividad es la venta de jugos de todos los sabores, los cuales los ofrece en vasos de todo tamaño. Su puesto se encuentra en una zona céntrica, cerca de una escuela, siendo los niños sus principales clientes. Esto sólo lo hace en las horas más calurosas del día, ya que cuando la mayoría consume sus bebidas de fruta. Por la noche, su actividad es el tejido de gorras a máquina, cuenta que realiza un promedio de ocho unidades, las que vende en un centro turístico de artesanía en la ciudad. Su trabajo es muy bueno y tiene muchos compradores. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en el trasporte de pasajeros. Las ganancias de ambos permiten solventar los gastos familiares.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres emprendedoras” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo brindado. Además, promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues las integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias. 
Gladys invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bancas y mayólicas para arreglar la barra de su puesto de jugos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old. She has been married to Fredy for 23 years, and they have two children: Cristian and Maciel.

Her main activity is selling juices of all flavors, which she offers in bottles of all sizes. Her stand is in a central area, near a school, the children being her main customers. She only does this during the hottest hours of the day, since that is when the majority consume their fruit drinks. At night, she knits hats on a knitting machine. She says that on average she produces eight units. She sells them in a tourist handcraft center in the city. Her work is very good and she has many buyers. For his part, her husband works transporting passengers. The earnings of both allow them to cover the household expenses.

She belongs to the "Mujeres Emprendadoras" ("Entrepreneurial Women") communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She is thankful for the help given to her. Also, she promises to be punctual with the loan repayments, since the members of her association are responsible and united people.

Gladys will use the money requested to purchase benches and mayolica tiles to fix up the bar of her juice stand.

loans.use: to fix up her juice stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric for his embroideries.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 40 años, es una mujer soltera y muy trabajadora. Vive sola en un espacio que acondicionó en el local de su negocio.
Gracias a sus estudios de farmacia pudo abrir una propia, también brinda los servicios de: aplicación de inyecciones, tratamientos con suero y dolores intramusculares. Le va muy bien, trabaja sin descanso de lunes a domingo, pues en la zona que vive no existe una farmacia, es la única que brinda este servicio. Como tiene mucha acogida, puso un teléfono público y también hace recargas para celulares, de donde obtiene ganancias extras. Ahora planea acondicionar otro espacio para instalar cabinas para hacer llamadas telefónicas a todo el país y el mundo, ya que ve en este negocio una oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos.

Ella se integró al grupo solidario “Mujeres emprendedoras” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado. Además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Tania invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más medicamentos para abastecer su farmacia.
texts.en:
Tania is 40 years old. She is single and a very hardworking woman. She lives alone in an outfitted space in her business.

Thanks to her pharmaceutical studies she could open a pharmacy herself, providing the services of: injections, treatments with serums and intramuscular pain. She is doing very well, she works without rest from Monday through Sunday, because there is no other pharmacy in her area, she is the only one giving this service. As she is well received, she put in a public telephone and also makes cell phone recharges, getting some extra income. Now she plans to outfit another space in order to install booths to make telephone calls all over the country and world, as she sees in this business an opportunity to increase her earnings. 

She joined the solidarity group Mujeres Emprendedoras and this is her first loan through MFP, and she is grateful for their support. Also she promises to make her payments on time, because the members of the association are trustworthy and a united group of people.

Tania will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of more medications to supply her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy more medications

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María vive en Quevedo tiene 35 años y está casada con Antonio. Tienen 4 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. María cuenta que desde niña veía la fabricación de ladrillos  ya que su padre es fabricante de ladrillos y le enseño. Ella ha hecho de esa enseñanza su negocio por eso decidió abrir su fábrica de manera independiente. El negocio lo realiza con su esposo, hermanos y jóvenes empleados que le ayudan desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la noche. Nos comento que su negocio es de arduo trabajo sin embargo con la unión de la familia han logrado levantar y crecer su negocio. Con el préstamo va a comprar materia prima para la realización de los ladrillos, herramienta, plásticos, etc. Nos comenta que su sueño es poder tener un horno industrial y una camioneta porque estos elementos son importantes para su negocio. Como meta nos dice que es darles bienestar a sus hijos, estudios e inculcar sus buenos valores..
texts.en:
María lives in Quevedo. She is 35 years old and is married to Antonio. They have 4 children who are school students. María says that since childhood she has seen bricks being made as her father makes bricks and taught her.

She has made this training her business and decided to open her own factory independently. She is in business with her husband, brothers and younger workers and they help her from 7:00AM in the morning until evening. She tells us that her business is hard work but with the family joining together they have managed to construct and grow their business.

With the loan she is going to buy prime materials in order to make bricks, and buy tools and plastic items, etc. She says that her dream is to be able to have an industrial oven and a truck because these items are important for her business. As a goal, she tells us, that she wants to give her children creature comforts, provide education, and inculcate good values.

loans.use: to buy clay, tools, and plastics

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Desde Playas conocemos a María quien tiene 50 años y vive en unión libre. Su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y juntos tiene una hija de 16 años que estudia en el colegio fiscal. María nos cuenta que empezó hace 6 años con una despensa  ya que tenía una hija especial y necesitaba de otro ingreso para los chequeos médicos. En principio era muy pequeña la tienda y tenía muy poco de cada cosa. En vista de que necesitaba incrementar sus ventas conoció a banco D –Miro y con los créditos que le han otorgado a podido ampliarlo. En la actualidad a parte de la despensa tiene una papelería atendida por ella. Ella abre a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de noche todos los días y cuando no puede la ayuda su sobrina. Nos comenta que en su sector hay ladrones pero no a tenido ningún problema de momento. En la entrevista quisimos conocer a su hija pero nos comenta que no resistió el tratamiento y lamentablemente falleció. Ahora su negocio ha sido su refugio ya que le ayuda a distraer la mente. Con el préstamo quiere surtir su negocio comprando víveres, frigorífico, etc. Su sueño es tener su tienda bazar grande con una casa más amplia. En lo familiar seguir en unión con su conyugué y su hija
texts.en:
María, 50 years old, is from the city of Playas and lives in a common law marriage. Her husband makes a living as a carpenter and together they have a 16-year-old daughter who studies at the public school. María tells us that six years ago she opened a store since she had a daughter with special needs and needed additional income for the medical bills. At first, it was a very small store and she had very little of everything.

Since she needed to increase her sales, she became familiar with D-Miro communal bank. The loans that they have granted have allowed her to increase her business. Currently, in addition to the store, she manages a stationary store. She opens at 7 in the morning until 10 at night every day. When she can't work, her niece helps. She tells us that her area has thieves but she has not had any problems so far. During the interview, we wanted to meet her daughter but she told us that her body did not respond to the treatment and, sadly, she passed away. Now her business has been a refuge because it helps her to clear her mind. With this loan, she wants to stock her business by purchasing supplies, a refrigerator, and other items. Her dream is to have a large store with a more spacious home. As for her family, she continues to live in a union with her spouse and her other daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a refrigerator

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amistad Y Lucha Group

texts.es:
MELICIA BARBARITA, tiene 70 años de edad, seis hijos mayores quienes son su apoyo. Ella forma parte del grupo "Amistad y Lucha" formado por 6 personas, vecinas del distrito de Comas.
Melicia Barbarita se dedica desde hace 14 años a la venta de artículos de pasamanería, es decir blonas, cintas, botones, cordones, grecas, todo lo referente a decoración de vestuario y telas, su negocio está ubicado en un mercado de la zona donde ella vive, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, es así que ella ha pocido mantenerse en su puestito asumiento de los gastos administrativos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas decoraciones, aplicaciones finas para el vestir.
texts.en:
Melicia Barbarita is 70 years old and has six adult children who are her support. She is part of the Amistad y Lucha [Friendship and Struggle] group, which consists of six people who are neighbors in the Comas district. 

For 14 years Melicia Barbarita has sold decorative accessories such as lace, ribbon, buttons, cords, patterns - everything related to accessorizing a wardrobe or fabric. Her business is located in a market in the area where she lives. Little by little she has increased her business, which is how she been able to maintain her little shop while taking on administrative costs. 

The loan she receives will be invested in the purchase of new decorations and fine accessories for clothing.

loans.use: to buy accessories such as lace, ribbon, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Xavier

texts.es: Cesar vive en La Libertad a sus 48 años mantiene a su familia con dos trabajos. Su principal fuente de ingreso es un taxi ya que es chofer profesional, en un principio tenía un taxi informal al irle bien en el negocio decidió ingresar a una cooperativa. Al principio no fue muy fácil ya que la adquisición de la placa es un proceso largo y costoso pero con un poco de esfuerzo lo realizo. El taxi lo maneja el sin problema alguno de momento y espero no tenerlos a futuro. También maneja una tienda la cual está ubicada en su domicilio y el tiempo lo comparte en ambas actividades. Es fácil ya que en su taxi sale en horas de mayor demanda que son mañana y noche. Está casada con Rosa quien es ama de casa y en sus tiempos libre le ayuda en la tienda. Tienen 1 hijo  quien estudia en la escuela fiscal cerca de su domicilio. El préstamo lo va a utilizar principalmente comprando inventario para la tienda en arroz, azúcar, harina, artículos varios, también comprar una puerta enrollable para la tienda con el fin de mejorar la seguridad. En el futuro desea tener mayores ingresos para su familia y así mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in La Libertad. At 48 years old he supports his family with two jobs. 

His main source of income is a taxi as he is a professional driver. Originally he had an informal taxi but as his business was going well he decided to join a taxi cooperative. At first it wasn't easy because acquiring a license plate is a long a long and costly process, but with effort he did it. He drives the taxi without any problems now and he hopes to avoid them in the future. 

He also runs a store which is located in his home and he spends his time between the two businesses. It's easy as he goes out in his taxi during the hours of peak demand which are the mornings and evenings. He is married to Rosa who is housewife and in her free time she helps out with the store. They have one child who goes to the public school close to their home. 

He will use the loan mainly to purchase inventory for the store like rice, sugar, flour, and other various items. He will also buy a roll-up door for the store in order to improve security. In the future he hope to make a better income for his family and in that way improve their finances.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and other various items.

loans.name: Yolanda Jessenia

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 31 años de edad y vive en Quevedo. Su negocio es la venta y compra de legumbre por menor. El puesto de negocio lo tiene ubicado en el centro de la ciudad ya que de esa manera tiene más ventas. 
Yolanda nos cuenta que aprendió el comercio gracias a su papá quien le enseño e inculco el valor de la responsabilidad y trabajo. Nos cuenta que sus primeras ventas las realizo colocando el producto en fundas para luego recorrer a pie los sectores. Era cansado pero de esta manera vendía más porque ella buscaba a los clientes. Cuando pudo reunir un poco de capital decidió independizarse alquilando un local. El negocio lo atiende ella  todos los días desde las 7:30 de la mañana en adelante. De momento nos comento que no tiene ninguna dificultad con ladrones ya que en el centro hay resguardo policial. Tiene 2 niñas quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal, Bella de 12 años y Daniela de 7 años. Con el crédito Yolanda espera comprar verduras para su venta como cebollas, ajos, papas en sacos para la distribución al menor. Espera con esto ampliar sus ventas para apoyar a sus hijas en el estudio y  sean profesionales así el día de mañana no tengas dificultades en la vida. Su sueño es tener una granja avícola para lo cual se está preparando.
texts.en:
Yolanda is thirty-one years old and lives in Quevado. Her business is the small-scale purchase and sale of vegetables. It is located in the city center, since this allows her to make more sales.

Yolanda tells us that she learned the business thanks to her father, who taught her and inculcated the value of responsibility and hard work. She tells us that she made her first sales by putting her products in cases and then covering the various sectors of the city on foot. She was often tired but she sold more this way because she could look for clients. When she was able to get together a little capital, she decided to become independent by renting a shop. She tends the business every day from 7:30 in the morning onward. At the moment, she tells us that she doesn't have any difficulty with thieves since there are police guards in the city center. 

Yolanda has two daughters who attend the public school: Bella, 12, and Daniela, 7. With this loan, Yolanda hopes to buy vegetables (including onions, garlic, and potatoes in sacks) for small-scale distribution. She hopes to increase her sales in this way in order to support her daughters in their studies and in becoming professionals so that they won't have difficulties in future life. Her dream is to have a poultry farm, which she is already preparing for.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, potatoes in sacks

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 49 años, es viuda desde hace 10 años. Tiene cuatro 4 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con dos de ellos, Javier y Carlos. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo.  
A la muerte de su esposo, abrió un restaurante en su vivienda. Gracias a su experiencia y junto a su hijo, planean tener un hotel y restaurante en una zona turística de la ciudad, ya tienen casi todo lo necesario y emprenderá este proyecto con buenas expectativas, sobre todo porque ya es conocedora del negocio. Sin embargo, su economía en la actualidad se centra en su restaurante, en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y la preparación de postres para toda ocasión, los que realiza a pedido de sus clientes, quienes saben de su buena sazón. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado personas solidarias y responsables.
Nora invertirá el dinero solicitado en el arreglo del techo, pasadizo e iluminación de local de su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Nora is 49, and has been a widow for 10 years. She has four children, two of whom live with her: Javier and Carlos. Her house is her own, and is located in the town of El Tambo.  

At the death of her husband, she opened a restaurant in her home. Thanks to her experience, she and her son plan to have a hotel and restaurant in a tourist area of the city. They already have almost everything necessary and will launch this project with good expectations, especially because she is already knowledgable about the business. 

However her livelihood currently centers on her restaurant, in selling beauty products by catalog, and in preparing desserts for every occasion, which she does through orders from her customers, who know about her tasty cooking.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she feels at ease about the loan support she is receiving, and appreciates the trust that they have in her. She promises to pay her installments on time, as she won't let her group down; it is made up of supportive and responsible people.

Nora will invest the money applied for to repair the ceiling, passageway, and lighting of the premises for her new business.

loans.use: To do a repairs on the premises for her new business.

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es:
Cindy tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Pero ella vive con su mamá debido a que su esposo no se encuentra en el país. Hace tres años se graduó de cosmetóloga y trabajo con una tía, pero desde hace un año ella instalo su propia sala de belleza en local que es propiedad de su mamá. 

Cindy desea mejorar la venta de productos cosmetologicos así como sus servicios, para brindarles el estudio a sus hijos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para ampliar el local y construir un plafón a la casa. Ella manifiesta que quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y un lugar en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Cindy is 25 years old. She is married and has two children, but she lives with her mother since her husband is not in the country. Three years ago, she graduated as a cosmetologist and worked with an aunt, but a year ago she opened her own beauty salon on premises owned by her mother.

Cindy wants to improve sales of cosmetology products as well as her services in order to provide her children with an education. This is why she is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to expand the premises and build a soffit on the house. She says she wants to improve her family's quality of life and have a place to live.

loans.use: to expand the premises and build a soffit on the house

loans.name: Cruz De Motupe Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagro, tiene 36 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "Cruz de Motupe" formado por 7 socias residentes del distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Milagro se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de lonches, todas las tardes, incia su negocio en la puerta de su domicilio vendiendo café, sanguches y comida, inició éste negocio para poder apoyar en los gastos familiares, y poco a poco se ha vuelto en un trabajo rentable, que le brinda una cierta estabilidad económica.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de vajilla y algunos insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Milagro is 36 years old. She is part of the Cruz de Motupe [Cross of Motupe] group, which is made up of seven women who are residents of the Comas district. 

For two years Milagro has sold tea time meals every afternoon. She started her business in the door of her home, selling coffee, sandwiches, and food. She started this business to be able to help with family expenses, and little by little it's become a profitable job, which gives her a certain economic stability. 

The loan she receives will be invested in the purchase of dishes and some consumable goods for food preparation.

loans.use: to buy goods to prepare tea time meals.

loans.name: Atitso

texts.fr:
Atitso est un homme âgé  de 41 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse et a un enfant agé de 12ans qui est scolarisé.  Atitso travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et des produits congelés depuis 2004. Il exerce seul l’activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé.
Atitso a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés et des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Atitso voudrait faire prospérer l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Atitso is a 41-year-old man.  He is married to a reseller and has a 12-year-old child who is in school.  He has been reselling general food products and frozen goods since 2004.  He works alone in a shop and usually gets his supplies in Lomé.

Atitso has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy frozen goods and general food products.  

He wants to reinvest in the activity.  

In the coming years, he would like to see his business prosper and wants to ensure the happiness of his family.

loans.use: to buy general food products and frozen goods.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La Sra. Martha, tiene 4 hijos  es casada y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 6 años junto al grupo “Nueva Esperanza”, grupo conformado por 11 personas que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Martha se dedica a la crianza de pollos y trabaja  vendiendo huevos y carnes de pollo, ella empezó este negocio a raíz de que recibió un curso de la municipalidad de su distrito y con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado que sus  hijos estudien carreras técnicas como computación y gastronomía, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para vender comida (leche, arroz, condimentos).Martha  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Martha has four children, is married and has worked with Edaprospo for six years together with the "Nueva Esperanza" group. The group is made up of 11 people that make their livings in varied businesses in sales. 

Martha makes a living raising chickens and works selling eggs and chicken meat. She started this business after taking a course through the municipality in her district. After some time she has a loyal customer base. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to give her children technical educations like computing and gastronomy. 

In an effort to continue growing, she has requested a new loan to sell food (milk, rice, spices). Martha will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort as well as the loans from Edaprospo that will help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies (milk, rice, spices).

loans.name: Francisco Roberto

texts.es:
Francisco es un joven emprendedor de 18 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha; en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones le gusta preparar su plato favorito como es el riquísimo "Arroz Chaufa"; con mucho esfuerzo culminó sus estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado poder cursar una carrera universitaria.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo Francisco trabaja como operario textil en una empresa de su ciudad, él dedica  a su trabajo un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y se encuentra muy a gusto realizando su labor.
Francisco se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder remodelar el baño de su casa, así como algunas refacciones que necesita su cuarto; de esta manera podrá contar con mayor comodidad en su vivienda, mejorando su ambiente el cual favorecerá en su desarrollo; Francisco espera poder seguir trabajando para poder incrementar sus ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder adquirir un vehículo propio para poder trabajar en el.
texts.en:
Francisco is an enterprising youth of 18 years.  He is single and lives in the city of Chincha.  In his free time, he likes to listen to music.  Sometimes he likes to prepare his favorite meal, which is the delicious, "Arroz Chaufa."  With much effort, he finished his secondary studies, but he would've liked to be able to go to college.  With a lot of determination and enthusiasm, Francisco works as a textile worker at a company in his city.  He works approximately 8 hours a day, and he likes his job.

Francisco is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be be able to make improvements to his home.  He hopes to be able to remodel his bathroom and make some repairs to his bedroom.  In this way, he will be able to have more comfort in his home and improve his environment, which will be beneficial to his development.  Francisco hopes to be able to keep working to increase his income so in the not-too-distant future, he can acquire a vehicle to be able to work on it.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.  He hopes to be able to remodel his bathroom.

loans.name: Los Emergentes Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y es socia del grupo "Los Emergentes", formado por 9 integrantes, residentes del distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Gladys se dedica desde hace mas de 30 años a la confección y compostura de prendas de vestir, inició ofreciendo servicio de compostura es decir entallados, correción de bastas, etc, poco a poco y a requerimiento de su clientela empezó a confeccionar, es así que ella llega a tener solvencia económica para poder cubrir sus gastos primordiales.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura como hilos, agujas, cierres, etc.
texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old, and she has three children.  She is a member of Los Emergentes communal bank.  There are nine members in the communal bank, and the members live in the Comas district.  

Gladys has been making and mending clothing for over 30 years.  She started by offering her mending services, that is to say fittings and alterations, etc.  Little by little she started making clothes that her clientele required.  This is how she became financially solvent and able to cover her essential expenses.  

She will use the received loan to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, and zippers, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, and zippers, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Eugenio

texts.es: Pedro a sus 46 años tiene una papelería en Libertad. Está casado y tiene 2 hijos. El negocio lo abrió en su domicilio y lo inicio investigando que productos no era predecible y que le generaran menos gastos. Como la mayoría de los artículos son de papel no demanda mucha atención, lo único es que debe actualizarse siempre para ofrecer variedad. Nos comenta que en la temporada escolar es donde más vende. La atención de la papelería la realiza con su esposa con quien se turnan. Pedro nos comenta que como su señora no trabaja opto por buscar otro trabajo donde labora en turnos rotativos. Gracias a esto puede atender su negocio y mejorar su economía. De sus hijos nos indica que uno es de 7 años de edad y estudia en una escuela al frente de su vivienda, su segunda hija tiene 3 años. Nos cuenta que su meta es expandir su negocio para poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y a su esposa. Espera con el préstamo comprar mercadería para sus papelería para sí lograr poco a poco su expansión..
texts.en: Pedro is 46 years old and has a stationery store in Libertad. He is married and has 2 children. He opened his business in his home and he started investigating which products were less predictable and would generate less expenses. Since most of the items are paper they do not demand a lot of care, the only thing is to always have a variety to offer. He tells us that the school season is when the most is sold. He attends to the store alternating with his wife. Pedro comments to us that as his wife was not working she choose to look for another job where she works alternating shifts. Thanks to this she can assist the business and improve the finances. He indicates to us that one of his children is 7 years old and is studying at a school opposite his house, and his second daughter is 3 years old. He says that his goal is to expand his business in order to give a better future to his children and his wife. With the loan he will buy merchandise for his stationery store in order to expand little by little.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils and bristol board

loans.name: Maria Aydee

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora de 46 años, viven en la ciudad de Pisco, es madre soltera y tiene 2 a quienes se dedica por completo para sacar adelante y darles un mejor futuro, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar el riquísimo Arroz con Pato, el cual es uno de sus platos favoritos y el de sus hijos.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus hermanas, desde hace mas de 5 años María trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y cervezas, ella dedica un aproximado de 13 horas diarias a su negocio, en las cuales puede atender hasta 35 clientes; ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su experiencia, amabilidad y atención a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, como abarrotes: arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. para abastecer su tienda; de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y  con ello en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder adquirir un nuevo local en el mercado central de su ciudad para expandir su negocio y poco a poco con empeño desea poder terminar de construir su vivienda y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising 46-year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Pisco.  She is the single mother of 2 children, to whom she dedicates herself completely to get ahead and give them a better future.  In her free time, she likes to prepare a delicious dish, rice with duck, which is one of her and her children's favorite meals.

With a lot of determination and dedication, and thanks to the support of her sisters, she started her business selling groceries and beer more than 5 years ago.  She works approximately 13 hours a day in her business, during which she can attend up to 35 customers.  She believes that her business is going well due to her experience, friendliness, and customer service.

María is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase merchandise like groceries (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) to supply her store.  In this way, she will be able to increase her income.  In the not-too-distant future, she hope to be able to acquire a new location in the central market of her city to expand her business.  Little by little, she hopes to be able to finish building her home and offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like groceries (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) to supply her store.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Edita  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Edita   trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de golosinas en frente de un  colegio este trabajo surge porque ella quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus 7 hijos  y a su vez trabaja en un comedor popular de cocinera , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos pueden ir al colegio ,  se ha comprado algunos artefactos eléctricos y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería dulces ( galletas, chocolates). Edita  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Edita is married and has seven children. Currently she is a member of the communal bank "Las Violetas". The group is made up of ten members that make their livings in different sales businesses. 

Edita has worked for 15 years selling sweets in front of a school. This business started because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and in supporting their children as her husband's earnings weren't sufficient to maintain their seven children. At the same time she works in a popular cafeteria as a cook. But thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to improve her financial income. Her children can go to school and she has purchased some household appliances. Above all, her family has a better quality of life. 

The loan she has been given will be used to purchase sweets merchandise (cookies, chocolates). Edita will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort as well as the loans from Edaprospo, which will help her.

loans.use: to buy sweets (cookies, chocolates, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Diana Virginia

texts.es: Diana de 31 años está casada y vive en Libertad junto a su familia. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en el Municipio de Santa Elena. Sus hijos se encuentran en la etapa escolar y estudian la escuela fiscal del Libertad. El negocio el cual es la venta de dulces lo inicio al momento en que se quedo sin empleo al no encontrar trabajo comenzó a vender dulces caseros puerta a puerta. Nos cuenta que no fue fácil al principio ya que en temporada de lluvia es muy dificultoso realizar la labor de entrega. Pasando un tiempo consiguió un local cerca de su actual vivienda donde realiza la producción y venta del producto. Diana nos informa que no maneja sola el negocio para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo  y sus hijos. Ellos le ayudan principalmente los fines de semana y feriados ya que en esos días son más rentables para su negocio. Con el préstamo quiere surtir los ingredientes para la elaboración de los dulces. También va a comprar vitrinas y elementos que son para la decoración de los dulces. Su sueño es poder terminar su vivienda ya que es mixta de caña y bloque, es por esto que sigue levantando su negocio cada día
texts.en: Diana is 31 years old, is married and lives in Libertad together with her family. Her husband works as a security guard in the municipality of Santa Elena. Her children can be found in school and they study at the public school of Libertad. She began her business, which is the sale of candies, at the moment when she was without work and couldn't find work. She began to sell homemade candies door to door. She told us that it was not easy at the beginning, since during the rainy season it is very difficult to accomplish delivery work. She spent a period finding a location near her current home where she performs the production and sale of the product. Diana told us that she does not manage the business alone, she counts on the help of her husband and her children. They primarily help during the weekends and holidays since those days are more profitable for her business. With the loan she wants to supply the ingredients for the creation of the candies. Also, she is going to buy windows and elements that are for the display of the candies. Her dream is to be able to complete her house which is a mix of cane and bricks, it is for this that she continues promoting her business each day.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to make candies

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mamisa, leader de l’association de crédit  « MIzeituni », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 6 jeunes enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse de sorgho. Son mari est Infirmier vétérinaire. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de Nyabushongo. Elle commença son business par la vente de semoule avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Alors, plus tard elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de 50$ de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8  cycles en profitant  du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité dans l’intérieur de la province constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités.  Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de sorgho et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans la scolarité des enfants.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir  et  acheter une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées de pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière.  Il sied se signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The borrower, Mamisa, is the leader of the credit group "Mizeituni".  She is a dynamic 39-year-old entrepreneur, mother of 6 young children who all attend school.  

Mamisa sells sorghum.  Her husband works as a veterinary nurse.  Mamisa sets her goods at the local market in Nyabushongo.  She started her business selling semolina and using her own capital, which she received from her husband.  Later on, she received a 50 USD loan from the MFI Hekima as additional funding.  Mamisa has been involved in this type of small income-generating activity for more than four years.

Mamisa has completed 8 loan cycles using the microcredit program offered through the MFI Hekima.  Insecurity inside her province constitutes a threat for the development of her activities.

This new loan will help her to buy 2 sacks of sorghum, and with the remainder of the money, she will pay her children's school fees.

Mamisa would like to see her children grow, and she would also like to buy a house.  She thanks Hekima for helping low-income women become financially and economically independent.  It should be noted that, [in the photo] ,some borrowers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sorghum.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por que se desarrolla la agricultura, es especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, uva, esparrago, entre otros.  Cuando Sonia tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer y en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chicharrón de Chancho”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería, por ello ella trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 17 y 11 años, ya que ella quiere que sean mejores que ella.

Con mucho entusiasmo Sonia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, juguetes, adornos, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes de manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trata de manera mable a los clientes.

Sonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa de invierno (casacas, pantalones, buzos, chompas, entre otros), así podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande para darle lo mejor a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Sonia is a very hard-working woman.  She lives in the district of Santiago, which is known for its agriculture, especially for growing cotton, paprika, grapes, asparagus, and other crops.  When Sonia has free time, she likes to read.  Sometimes she likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, "chicarrón de chancho" (pork cracklings).  She only studied through secondary school, but she would have like to have studied nursing.  This is why she works very hard to take good care of her two children, who are 17 and 11, because she wants them to be better than she is.

With a lot of enthusiasm, Sonia works in her business selling clothing, toys, decorations, and other items.  She spends around 8 hours a day working, and she can attend to up to 6 customers daily.  She believes that her business is going well because she treats her customers in a friendly manner.

Sonia is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business like winter clothing (jackets, pants, sweatshirts, sweaters, etc.) so she can have a larger variety of products to sell in her business and improve her income.  This will let her keep fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: "to have a bigger business to give the best to my children."

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (winter clothing like sweaters, pants, jackets, etc.).

loans.name: Angelica Raquel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angélica, tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cinco ciclos y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de ayudar a su madre en las tareas del hogar también se dedica al comercio, ella vende joyas bañadas en oro, ropa  por catalogo de muchas marcas. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan  algún producto de los que ella vende. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana de lunes a viernes ya que descansa los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, cada quince o al mes si así lo prefieren sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Lleva más de diez años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar joyas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
In the citadel of the new California in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí known from many years ago as the city of the “Reales Tamarindos”, gather every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank New Jerusalem.

Here we met the Angelica, who is 48 years of age, divorced and has no children. She lives in her parents' house. She has been with the Communal Bank already five cycles and likes it for the speed with which loans are giving.

Our friend is a very hard working woman that in addition to helping her mother with the household chores also makes a living selling; she sells gold plated jewelry and clothes catalog of many brands. In addition to products of Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for ladies).

Her form of sale is door-to-door and also sells in her house, where her customers come when they need a product. She works five days a week from Monday to Friday since she rests on weekends. She sells on credit and collects on a weekly, bi-weekly or monthly basis, depending of her customers’ preferences. Her products are sent to her home and the clothing is in the center of a distributor. She has been more than ten years in this business and she has done very well.

This loan is to buy jewelry, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing of all kinds. 

Her dream is to have her own home because where she lives belongs to her mom.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a sewing machine, an emery, and shoe cleaning materials

loans.name: Souraya

texts.fr: Souraya est âgée de 30ans. Elle est mariée à un maçon et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 06ans et le dernier 01an. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale à toutes personnes dans sa boutique.  Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Souraya is 30 years old.  She is married to a bricklayer and has two children, one of whom is in school.  Her oldest child is six years old, the youngest is one.

She sells general food products to all clients in her shop.

She is requesting this first loan from WAGES for the purchase of goods, in order to better meet her customers' needs.  

She wants to reinvest in the activity and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Jacqueline Tomasa

texts.es:
Jacqueline nació y continúa viviendo en Libertad. A sus 36 años tiene una papelería ubicada en su domicilio. Jacqueline nos cuenta que el negocio surgió por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos.
Hace 3 años después de un terrible accidente en la cual quedo viuda decidió abrir la papelería. Esta fue la mejor decisión ya que el negocio la distrae manteniéndola activa. Su horario de atención es de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo atiende ella sin problemas, a veces sus hijos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres. Tiene 2 niños de 7 y 5 años que asisten a la escuela fiscal cerca de la casa. Le preguntamos si ha tenido algún problema en el barrio y nos confirma que no ya que es muy seguro. Ella espera con el préstamo comprar cuadernos, lápices productos escolares así como un congelador para empezar la venta de helados. Su sueño futuro es ampliar el negocio que tiene porque es su único sustento económico.
texts.en:
Jacqueline was born and continues living in Libertad. At 36 years old she has a stationary store located in her home. Jacqueline told us that the business arose from the need to support her children.

Three years after a terrible accident that left her a widow, she decided to open the stationary store. This was the best decision since the business distracted her and kept her busy. Her business hours are from Monday to Saturday from 9 in the morning until 7 in the evening. She told us that the business serves her without problems and sometimes her children help her in their free time. She has two children who are 7 and 5 years old that attend the public school near her home. We asked her if she had any problems in the neighborhood and she told us that it is not very safe. She hopes that with the loan she will buy notebooks and pencils, and products for schoolchildren like an ice cream machine to begin the sale of ice creams. Her future dream is to grow the business that she has because it is her only economic livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pencils and products for schoolchildren

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, snacks, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Gema Liliana

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive a la señora Gema, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de tres años los de edad. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda. Trabaja cuatro días de la semana tanto en sus entregas como en los cobros ya que deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene casi tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho.

Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
In Santa Martha in the Riochico parish of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Querer es Poder de Riochico" meets every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its vegetation, where most of the residents work in agriculture.

Here we meet Gema, 20, who is in a common-law marriage and has a 3 year-old daughter.  Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend Gema, in order to earn something on her own and get ahead, has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door, and also from her house where her customers come when they need some new clothes.  She works 4 days a week, both delivering garments and making collections, as she sells on credit and then collects every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise every time she needs it.  She has been doing this work for almost 3 years, and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been with her communal bank for 3 loan cycles, and she likes it because she can get the loans quickly and they help her a lot.

She dreams of continuing forward with her business and her family life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Madéo

texts.fr:
Madeo est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 23 ans et le dernier a 14 ans.
Madeo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des appareils électroménagers  pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Madeo a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils électroménagers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Madeo voudrait ouvrir une seconde boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madéo is a 50-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of four children, one of whom is in school.  Her oldest child is 23 years old, the youngest is 14.

Madéo has been working as a reseller since 2002.  She sells household electrical appliances to all clients, in her shop.  She buys her products in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her major difficulty is that she is out of stock.

Madéo has requested a third loan from WAGES for the purchase of electrical appliances.  She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, she would like to open a second shop.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for their motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Alexandra Piedad

texts.es:
Alexandra vive en Libertad. Tiene 52 años y está casada con Joaquín quien es chofer de profesión. Tienen 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Su casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona conocida como Rio Verde donde tiene su gabinete de belleza llamado Peluquería Alexandra. 
Hace 29 años que se dedica a este trabajo el cual le gusta mucho. Al principio realizaba visitas al domicilio de sus clientas dando a conocer su trato y trabajo. Luego de 20 años pudo tener capital suficiente para amoblar el local en su casa y poner la peluquería. En la actualidad se desempeña sola trabajando todos los días desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Alexandra nos cuenta que mayor problema es al comprar los productos que utiliza ya que le toca viajar a Guayaquil. A pesar de todo le va muy bien y no queja. Esperan con el crédito comprar tintes y cremas  para el cabello. Espera continuar trabajando como hasta ahora para estar tranquila en su economía.
texts.en: Alexandra lives in Libertad. She is 52 years old and is married to Joaquín who is a driver by profession. She has two children that attend the public school. Her house is located in the area known as Rio Verde (Green River) where she has her beauty salon called Peluquería Alexandra. For 29 years she has been dedicated to this work that she likes very much. In the beginning she performed visits to the homes of her clients publicizing her treatment and work. Later, after 20 years she had sufficient capital to furnish a location in her house and to set up the salon. Nowadays, she performs work alone every day from 10 in the morning until 7 in the evening. Alexandra told us that her biggest problem is buying the products that she uses since they make her travel to Guayaquil. In spite of everything, it goes very well and she does not complain. She hopes that with the loan she will buy dyes and creams for hair. She hopes to continue working like she is now to be comfortable in her economic position.

loans.use: to buy dyes, makeup and a dryer.

loans.name: Jeraldine Veronica

texts.es:
Jeraldine es una joven de 20 años, muy emprendedora y trabajadora, es soltera y vive con su familia en la ciudad de Chincha, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es la riquísima "Sopa Seca con Papa a la Huancaína". 
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su familia, Jeraldine puso en marcha su negocio de tener una librería, donde vende artículos de oficina, así como brinda servicios de fotocopias y anillados; ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 13 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 40 cliente, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a la variedad de productos, rapidez y buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes.
Jeraldine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de computadoras y podrá complementar su negocio con cabinas de internet;  de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos contribuyendo poco a poco a lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y ser una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Jeraldine is a young 20-years-old woman, very entreprenurial and hard working. She is single and lives with her family in the city of Chincha. In her leisure time enjoys listening to music and sometimes prepares one of her favorite dishes as is the "Sopa Seca con Papa a la Huancaína", a potato soup. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and the support of her family, Jeraldine launched an office-suply store, where she sells office supplies, as well as photocopy services and ring-binding; she works approximately 13 hours a day, in which can accommodate up to 40 customers, she thinks that her business is running well due to the variety of products, fast and good attention she offers to her customers.

Jeraldine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as because of their support, she would be able to purchase computers to complement her business with internet booths; as a result, she could increase her income and little by little achieve her great dream of having her own home and being a woman of good.

loans.use: to purchase computers and other supplies needed to add internet booths to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de siete años los de edad, la misma que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en el extranjero. 

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes, cremas y carteras, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando ella recibe la mercadería ya que es su esposo le envía desde los EE.UU o sino una señora también le trae de este país, por lo cual sus clientes a penas le llega algo nuevo se acercan hasta su casa para comprar sus productos , ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene siete años que se dedica a esta actividad, empezó  después de que nació su hija y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en pagar la ropa, las carteras y los perfumes que recién le llego. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
In the Santa Martha zone of the Riochico parish in Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Querer es poder de Riochico" ("Where there's a will there's a way" of Riochico) gather together every 15 days. This area is known for its vegetation and most of its inhabitants work in agriculture.
There lives Susana. She's 26 years old and in a common law marriage. From this union she has a 7-year-old daughter who attends school. Her husband works abroad.
Our friend has the drive to earn her own income and therefore be able to get ahead. She sells clothing, perfumes, lotions and purses. She sells door-to-door and also from her home, where her customers arrive once she receives the merchandise her husbands sends from the U.S. There's also a lady who brings her merchandise from that country, and as soon as something new arrives, her customers come to her home in order to buy her products. She sells to her customers on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She has been in this business for 7 years; she started it after her daughter was born and it's going very well.
She will use this loan to pay for the clothing, the purses and the perfumes she just received. She has been in the communal bank from the very beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.
Her dreams are to make progress in her business and in her family life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, purses and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for her motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Bella Roxana

texts.es: Bella nació en Milagros. Tiene 21 años a su corta edad es una emprendedora con mucho éxito y ganas de superación personal y económica. Es vendedora ambulante de sabanas, blusas, toldos. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo aprendió de su madre con quien sale a vender. Bella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho lo que realiza ya que el tiempo lo distribuye ella así como su sueldo el cual depende de sus ventas. No tiene un horario de trabajo definido pero cuando tiene un pedido es muy puntual. Su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia ya que si la ven sola le roban lo trabajado en el día o la mercadería. No está casada pero tiene 2 hijos  de 5 y 1 año como vive en la casa de sus padres sus hijos quedan al cuidado de una de sus sobrinas. El préstamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de edredones, ropa interior, sabanas, toldos. La meta que se ha propuesto es abrir un negocio estable así dejaría de recorrer las calles. Esperamos que tus metas se cumplan Bella suerte.
texts.en:
Bella was born in Milagros. She is 21 years old and at her young age she is a very successful entrepreneur, and is eager to achieve her best personally and financially. She works selling bed sheets, shirts and mosquito nets from place to place.  She learnt this business from her mother with who she goes out selling. Bella likes her work very much since she can organise her time around her sales work, and her salary depends on her sales. She does not have a fixed timetable for work but when she has an order she is very punctual. Her biggest worry is crime since if someone sees her alone they can steal her daily earnings or merchandise.  She is not married but she has two children of 5 and 1 years old, and since she lives in her parents’ house they are looked after by her nieces.

She will use the loan to buy eiderdown, underwear, bed sheets, mosquito nets. The goal she has set herself is  to open a steady business so that she can quit selling in the street. 

Banco D-MIRO S.A. says "We hope you achieve your goals Bella, good luck"

loans.use: to buy eiderdown, underwear, bed sheets and mosquito nets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mónica Marbella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
La señora Mónica tiene 48 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 28, 22 y 21 años, todos aun viven con ella y  dos de ellos estudia en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y bisutería. Tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí llegan muchos de sus clientes que le hacen pedidos. Además dos veces por semana ella sale a recorrer por la ciudad para cobrar al mismo tiempo realiza nuevas ventas ya deja sus productos a créditos y cobra cada ocho días, ella compra sus productos en Portoviejo  y Guayaquil, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ha dejado muy agradable momentos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños y bisuteía. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace más de cuatro años y le agrada porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial bien surtido.
texts.en:
In the citadel of the new California in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí known from many years ago as the city of the “Reales Tamarindos”, gather every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank New Jerusalem.

Mónica is 48 years old, she is married and, fruit of her relation, has three children of 28, 22 and 21 years of age. They all live with her. Two of them study in the University. Her husband is a merchant

Our friend makes a living selling clothes of all kinds and costume jewelry. She has a small place in her house, there come many of her customers who wants to buy her products. Also twice a week she goes out to sell door-to-door and collect at the same time. She makes new sales, provides credit and collects every eight days. She buys her products in Portoviejo and Guayaquil. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. This activity has giving her some many pleasant moments.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing, such as: pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes and jewelry. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than four years; this pleases her because the loans allow her to finance her business. 

Her dream is to have a well stocked commercial store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes and jewelry

loans.name: David Eduardo

texts.es:
David es un joven de 20 años el cual vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas y sobre todo con un paisaje precioso, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura , en especial el cultivo de arroz. Cuando David tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecino de su barrio y en algunas oportunidades le gusta pedirle a su esposa que ele preparare uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado, sobre todo porque lo disfruta al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 4 meses al cual adora mucho y por quien trabaja muy duro para sacarlo adelante.

Con mucho entusiasmo David trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

David está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá  comprar un vehículo para poder realizar su trabajo como chofer ya que actualmente el vehículo que maneja es alquilado, de esta manera ya no pagara alquileres y sobre todo mejorara sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
David is a 20 year old young man who lives in the city of Camana, a city known for its warm climate, beautiful beaches, and above all a beautiful landscape.  At the same time it develops its agriculture, especially rice.  When David has some free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  Sometimes he asks his wife to prepare one of his favorite dishes, such as delicious “Lomo Saltado,” mainly because he enjoys sharing it with his wife and his young four month old son whom he loves very much and for whom he works very hard.
 
David works with great enthusiasm in his business, driving a taxi.  He works about ten hours each day and can serve up to 40 customers.  He believes that he is doing well in his business because he is friendly with his customers.

David appreciates the Kiva loans and thanks to them he will be able to buy a vehicle to be able to do his work as a driver; his current vehicle is rented.  In this way he will not pay rent and above all will improve his income.  It will allow him to realize his greatest dream, “Improve his home.”

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is from the village of San Isidro in the province of Isabela. She is 48 years old and married with four adult children. Mercedes had a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past 20 years. She provides economic support for her family. Mercedes considers herself to be a hardworking, honest person. She hopes to save enough money to renovate the family home. Mercedes would like a loan in order to purchase an additional pig. She expects her income to increase by 20 percent with this investment. Mercedes is pleased with the services of microfinance and says the prices are reasonable. She wants to continuing living in Quirino, surrounded by her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the village of Rizal in the province of Isabela. She is a hard-working woman who dreams of seeing her two children finish their college education. She is 42 years old and married to Roosevelt who is also her business partner. Their children are Sheila Mae and Lara Kaye.
Delia's family live in a community surrounded by hospitable, responsible and God-fearing people. She and her husband are engaged in farming which is their main source of income, but with their desire to provide a better life for their family, they also engage in other businesses such as hog-raising, furniture-making, welding and a small store in their village. Delia's products include basic commodities, rice, soft drinks, personal care items and hog feed.
Delia is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000  which will be used in their farm business since their income is not enough to sustain the next planting season. She hopes that through her loan their economic status will improve.

loans.use: to inject capital into her farm in order to make purchases such as seed and fertilizer for the next planting season

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose became a widower during the early years of his marriage. Since then, he has been the father and mother of his three daughters: Lean, Shella and Melvin Joy. Jose is very assiduous in his farming business. However due to lack of money, he cannot sustain all of his farming needs. He really needs to continue his farming business because it is the only means for him to send his children to school and for his eldest child to pursue her college education. He requests a loan of PHP 29,000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. He is really thankful to God that there are people who are willing to lend to him without asking for high interest like the traders do. He is proud that despite being a single parent, he still manages to send his children to school. He is able to do this because he manages his farm and hog-raising businesses well. Jose is a man with a word of honor. He does not promise anything that he is not sure of. He said that he will sacrifice everything to provide a better life for his children, so he has to work hard and pray for his success.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Daté
