Trabaja muy duro para colaborar con la economía del hogar, ya que la situación económica es muy difícil y muchas veces no logra cubrir las principales necesidades de su familia. Con mucho entusiasmo se acerco a esta institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar credito, con el cual desea invertir en la compra de detergentes y papel higiénico al por mayor. Con el fin de impulsar las ventas,  para que generen mayores ganancias que permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia is 36 years old and she lives with her partner and her children. She works selling detergent and toilet paper. She sells them on foot throughout the different areas in the zone where she lives. She's been selling these items for many years and has a lot of experience. This has helped Sandra win her customers' trust and every day more and more choose her. 

Sandra is very hard-working, entrepreneurial and friendly. She works very hard to contribute to the household economy because her economic situation is very difficult and often the money doesn't go far enough to meet her family's basic needs. She was very excited to request a loan from INTEGRAL, which she would like to invest in buying detergent and toilet paper in bulk. Sandra hopes to increase sales and generate more income which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy detergents and toilet paper in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a mother of two children, age 10 and 5 years, and she has been actively farming for 15 years in her rural home area. She sells her farm products of maize, milk and beans to the local market. She also has a cereals retail business in the local market to supplement her farming income.

Alice has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She hopes setting up an irrigation system will improve her farming income and help her in paying for the education of her two children.

Alice says the main challenge in farming is the unreliable rains, but she is optimistic that she can meet this challenge.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been in farming for ten years, producing milk, maize and beans, which he sells locally. He is married and has three children between 15 and 7 years old. He also works as a welder in the local market.

Francis has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. He says dairy cows have been very vulnerable to inadequate rains and diseases, but dairy goats will be more resistant to such challenges besides producing more nutritious milk. He plans to venture into fish farming in the future. He adds that the farming income will help him in educating his children.

Francis says Juhudi Kilimo financial services have been a great blessing to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Rosalid

texts.en:
Rosalid is 42 years old and has been in farming for ten years. Currently, she runs her farm with one farmhand and produces maize, bananas and milk for sale to the local market. She also works as support staff at a local hospital. 

She lives with her family of three children, age 18 to 10 years, in their rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya.

Rosalid has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into a poultry farming business by buying poultry birds. She says the poultry business has good prospects due to good market prices for both birds and eggs. She says the business will help in paying for her last child's education.

Rosalid says rampant crop failure due to poor rains is the main challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam is a 32-year-old married lady who has two daughters and lives with her family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, which lacks basic infrastructure. 

Since November, 2011, she has been operating a small grocery store business at the local outer district of the city. 

When she started her business, she bought her small store for 22,000,000  Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). First she paid 14,000,000  MNT and recently she paid the last amount. 

Now she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 47 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  He is from the village of Calaocan. His wife manages their hog-raising business. Edwin has been engaged in corn production for almost 10 years. He earned approximately 45,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from his last crop. 

Edwin is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production. He and his wife work hard to provide for their needs and give their children a good quality of life and send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer  tiene 31 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañera de vida la cual es ama de casa y sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian en la zona. Él se dedica a la venta y crianza de pollos de engorde y cerdos de clase. Posee mucha experiencia en esta actividad, por lo que ya posee clientes fijos, los cuales le demandan sus animales cuando están en las condiciones adecuadas para la comercialización. Sus clientes y vecinos dan buenas referencias de él y de su trabajo ya que  siempre trata de mantenerlos satisfechos para que siempre estén motivados a regresar y continuar demandando sus animales. Habita en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a su familia, esto lo motiva a continuar trabajando con más ganas para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Como todo hombre emprendedor con deseos de superarse ha tomado la decisión de solicitar esté crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de cerdos de clase y pollos de engorde. Con el fin de dar un impulso a su negocio que le permita incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos, como consecuencia espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 31, lives with his family, which is comprised of his life partner, who is a housewife, and their two minor children.  The children attend school in the area.

He raises chickens and pigs that have been bred to fatten and sell.  He has a lot of experience in this business activity.  Therefore, he has fixed customers, and his animals are in demand when they have reached an adequate growth to be sold.

His customers and neighbors give him and his work good references.  He always tries to keep them satisfied so that they are always motivated to return and continue buying his animals.  

He lives in very simple and humble conditions with his family.  This motivates him to be even more eager to continue working in order to bring home the daily bread. 

Like all enterprising men, he wishes to improve himself.  He has made the decision to request this loan from Integral to buy pigs that have been bred and chickens to fatten.  He will do this to give his business a boost.  This will allow him to increase his sales and his income.  As a consequence, he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs that have been bred and chickens to fatten.

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David de 59 años de edad, habita junto a su esposa. Él se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de prendas de vestir. Dicho oficio lo aprendió hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a sus conocimientos en la confección, es como logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Con mucho sacrificio y dedicación ha logrado mantener activo su negocio, pese al número abundante de negocios similares que existen en la zona. José siempre está un paso delante de la competencia, esto es lo que le ha permitido sobrevivir en el mercado de la confección. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de: telas, hilos, elásticos, tijeras, botones, etc. de esta forma espera continuar operando, ya que éste negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y quiere mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo, y así continuar llevando el pan  de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
José David is 59 years old and he lives with his wife. He works making and selling clothes. He learned his trade many years ago. Thanks to his knowledge for making clothes, he is able to put food on the table. With a lot of sacrifice and dedication he has been able to keep his business going, despite the number of similar businesses in the area. 

José is always one step ahead of the competition, which has helped him to survive in the clothing business. He is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing fabric, thread, elastic, scissors, buttons, etc. He hopes to keep his business thriving because it is his main source of income and allows him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, scissors and buttons.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is 57 years old. He has been engaged in the farming business for over 25 years. He lives with his wife and three children. 

He wants to further develop his business in order to continue to live a comfortable life. In order to do this, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides for use in his business. 

With the help of these inputs he hopes to improve his farm and yield more productive harvests.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide for use in his business.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.en:
Ciriaco is 51 years old, a college graduate who has not had the privilege to look for better employment due to the employment crisis of the country. But in spite of this, he has still developed his own family through his farming business. As of now, he has four children who are asking assistance from him.

So Ciriaco wants to grow his profit for his children and grandchildren. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that his crops will not be destroyed by any disastrous insects or typhoons. 

The crops will enable him to earn a higher income that can be used for his family's future as well as to save for continuing his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a farmer in Murang’a in Central Kenya where he has been farming for twenty years and currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand, producing and selling milk and French peas.

Dominic has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter to help in easy feeding of his dairy animals. He adds the equipment will help reduce the waste on dairy feed. He plans to buy more dairy cows in the near future.

Dominic says instability in the market, especially for milk, with fluctuation in prices remains a serious challenge.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter (to cut fodder)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 55 years old, and he operates a farming business in his village. He lives a simple life with his wife and four children. Every day, he goes into the field and spends all of his time working. Despite the difficulties of farming, he has the courage to persist in earning his family's income. 

Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm. He hopes that in the coming season he will produce better crops in order to save for his family as well as his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Maximo Isabel

texts.es: Máximo Isabel vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, maíz, frijol, entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y tiene una amplia experiencia, se siente orgulloso de que siempre realiza bien su trabajo obtiene las mejores cosechas y las mejore ganancias, el terreno está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas, se ha vuelto un excelente vendedor y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precio bajo y con un servicio excelente, Máximo se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, además trabaja de jornal, es decir prestando el servicio como empleado en agricultura para otros a fin de complementar los gastos del hogar; es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y a su familia, tiene grandes expectativas para el futuro y trabajara duro para alcanzar el éxito, en la última cosecha debido a las lluvias perdió un porcentaje, y ahora que empieza la temporada de sembrar nuevamente quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción, pero necesita de capital para insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, herbicidas, herramienta entre otros. Máximo Isabel es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, se hace responsable de cancelar el financiamiento en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Máximo Isabel lives with his life partner and children in his own house.  He works growing basic grains, corn and beans among others.  He has worked in agriculture for several years and has broad experience.  He is proud to always do his job well.  He gets the best harvests and profits.  His plot of land is located in an area with a high incidence of agriculture very close to his home.  He sells in all the neighboring areas.  He has become an excellent merchant and already has a lot of customers because they know that everything he sells is high quality at a low price and with excellent service.  Máximo is characterized by his great kindness.

In addition, he works as a day laborer; that is, offering his service as a farmworker for others with the goal of supplementing the household expenses.  He is an enterprising man, dedicated to his job and his family.  He has great expectations for the future and he will work hard to achieve success.

He lost a percentage of the last harvest because of the rains.  Now that the planting season is beginning again he wants to recover and increase production, but he needs capital for supplies.  This is why he is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools, among other things.

Máximo Isabel is very responsible and has good payment references.  He is assuming the responsibility of paying back the loan in the established period of time at the same time he is confident he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth tiene 33 años de edad y habita junto a sus dos hijos de de 13 y 8 años de edad los cuales se encuentran  estudiando. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa desde hace muchos años, razón  por la que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Vende en colonias, parques y fronteras cercanas a donde reside. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora.  Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales ya que para ella es muy importante que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben, ya que solo de esta forma logrará mantenerlos contentos y  quedarán con ganas de regresar a su negocio.  Ha estado pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio y ha llegado a la conclusión que la mejor forma es solicitando este crédito a INTEGRAL e invirtiendo en la compra de  ropa al por mayor como: faldas, camisas, pantalones, shorts, ropa interior, etc. con el fin de lograr una mayor preferencia y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Lizeth is 33 years old and lives with her two children, ages 13 and 8, who are currently in school. She works selling clothes and has been doing so for many years. As a result, she has a lot of experience and lots of regular customers who bring her more business every day. She sells in neighborhoods, parks and other areas where she lives. Sandra is a responsible, hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. 

She has very good personal references because it's very important to her that her customers are satisfied with the service they receive. That's the only way to keep them happy and coming back to her business. Sandra has been thinking of ways to grow her business and has decided that the best way is to request a loan from INTEGRAL and invest it in buying clothing in bulk like skirts, shirts, pants, shorts, underwear and more. This way she can offer her customers a wider selection, increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, pants, shorts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 21 years old and has been in farming for three years in her rural home area in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She produces maize, beans, milk and coffee. She sells her produce to the local markets. She is married and has two children with the first born already schooling. 

Carol has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. She says this will help her construct a granary store for her farming produce such as maize and beans. This will help her have better return from her farming since she will be able to keep her produce safely and sell it when market prices are favorable, unlike during seasons of harvest. 

She also plans to buy more land with her income and improve her family's living standards.

She laments of poor markets and rampant crop failures as a result of inconsistent rains.

loans.use: To construct a granary.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa, age 34, is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is married with three children between 5 and 10 years old, all school-going. He has been in farming for six years. He sells his milk and eggs to the local market.

Musa has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic he will be able to own at least four dairy cows in five years and improve his family's living standards.

Musa says animal diseases are the inherent challenges to farming, particularly for dairy farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been in farming for 10 years in her rural home in Western Kenya, in the Kitale area. She is married with six children between the ages of 4 and 17. Her farm produces milk and eggs for the local markets.

Agnes has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this amount will boost her farming income for the family's consumption. She will use a major part of the income to buy a motorcycle to help in transporting her produce to the market as well as to enable her to earn more income from transport services offered to other farmers.

Agnes says animal diseases remain a major challenge in farming, especially for dairy farming since the animals are highly vulnerable to them.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in active farming in his rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for twenty years and currently produces mainly milk and vegetables. He is married with three children, two of whom are adults with the last-born being seventeen and schooling.

Stephen has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a zero-grazing unit which will help in saving on animal feed, especially during dry seasons. He believes he will earn enough income from the improved farming to educate the last-born child.

Stephen reiterates that the main challenge in farming remains lack of sufficient water.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa is 28 years old, married to a 25-year-old guy, and they have one son who attends kindergarten.  The family lives in an outer 'ger' district which lacks basic infrastructure, in Ulaanbaatar city. 

Tsevelmaa works as an accountant and her husband works as adaptation engineer at a local company. Both of their salaries' total is 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) per month.  Besides their work, the young couple are managing a billboard leasing business.  

Tsevelmaa owns all necessary compliance and other licenses, and now she and her husband need only capital finance. Thus she is requesting a 3,900,000 MNT loan to use for her billboard which she will lease out to others.

loans.use: to use for a billboard stand which she will lease out to others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es: Jorge Enrique tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Desde muy temprano sus padres le enseñaron el oficio del cultivo de la tierra. Aprendió todo lo relacionado con la agricultura y gracias a estos conocimientos es como se gana la vida en la actualidad y lleva el sustento a su familia. Cada año repite la misma dinámica de preparar la tierra, sembrar, sacar la cosecha, y por ultimo poner a la venta una parte de la misma. Con mucho esfuerzo lucha por sacar adelante a su querida familia ya que él es el principal sostén de su hogar y la agricultura es su principal fuente de ingresos. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra ya comenzó, solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL, para invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios (abonos, insecticidas, semillas, etc.) para dar inicio a la siembra lo más pronto posible ya que es muy importante para tener una cosecha abundante que le permita continuar llevando  el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jorge Enrique, 30, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  His parents taught him the trade of working the land from a very young age.  He learned everything about agriculture, and currently earns his living and supports his family thanks to this knowledge.  Every year he repeats the same dynamics of preparing the land, planting, harvesting, and finally selling a part of the harvest.

He fights with a lot of effort to get his beloved family ahead because he is the main support of his home and agriculture his main source of income.  The planting season already began, so he is asking Integral for this loan to invest in buying the necessary agricultural supplies (fertilizer, insecticide, seed, etc.) to start the planting as soon as possible.  It is very important to have an abundant harvest that will allow him to continue supporting his household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seed, etc.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es: José Carlos tiene 57 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su  compañero de vida, la cual es ama de casa y sus hijos. Él  se dedica  a la agricultura, principalmente a la siembra de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. De esta forma es como logran llevar el sustento a su hogar. El señor José es un hombre  increíble ya que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, carismático y responsable.  Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza la misma dinámica de sembrar y luego sacar la cosecha,  de la cual vende una parte  y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el sustento. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto le da fuerzas para  seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas (semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.) que son indispensables para obtener una cosecha abundante y así poder seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar  e ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia poco a poco.
texts.en:
José Carlos, age 57, lives in his own house with his family, which is comprised of his wife, who is a housewife, and his children.

He is a farmer, and he primarily grows corn.  He does this with his children’s help.  This is the way he manages to support his household.  José is an incredible man because he is known for being very hard-working, charismatic, and responsible.  He has been farming for a long time, therefore he knows how to do this work very well.

Each year he follows the same practice of planting and gathering the harvest.  He sells part of the harvest, and the other part is for consumption.  That is how, little by little, he is getting ahead and supporting his family.  He lives in very humble conditions with his family.  This gives him the strength to continue fighting for a different future.

He has made the decision to request this loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies (seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.).  These supplies are indispensable to getting an abundant crop, to be able to continue bringing home the daily bread, and to gradually improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is a 34-year-old married lady who has two sons and lives in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Both of her sons attend the local high school. Erdenetsetseg supports her family by operating a fruit selling business. 

With her husbands’ special help she operates her business successfully. This loan will be used to purchase a car for her husband. If he is able to run a taxi business, the family can increase their income.  As Erdenetsetseg wants to help her spouse, she is requesting a loan for 3,900,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase a car. They say, "From now on we must create savings for our sons' high education fee; therefore, we must increase our income.”

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio is a humble person with a strong personality. He’s also cheerful and very hardworking. He lives with his wife and three children in Cauayan, a province of Isabela. Arsenio raises corn, a business he started 10 years ago. He usually plants and harvests corn for sale.  Now, he needs to increase his business, which is why he’s taking out a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 for buying fertilizer and corn seeds for his business. This business helps Arsenio because it’s the only source of income he has to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for his business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a farmer in her rural home in Nkubu, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and one child, a toddler. She has been in farming for four years with farming being the major source of income for her family.  Faith also supplements her income with her retail business (shoe sales) in the local market.

Faith has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says rampant crop failure due to low rain has compelled her to diversify her farming. She plans to establish a good water-harvesting system in her farm and later venture into dairy farming, too.

She says poor markets and rampant crop failures are her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of four adults, between the ages of 31 and 21. Her last-born child is still pursuing a college education. 

Mary has been in farming for 10 years and currently sells her milk, eggs and maize to the local market. She runs a salon business in the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is focusing on owning at least four dairy cows. She also plans to venture into a transport business in the future to improve her family's living standards.

Mary says animal diseases are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is 38 years old and an industrious father of two children. He is very enthusiastic to support his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but is not be able to save for the education of his children. So, he is requesting a loan of P25,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. He hopes to protect his business with his loan, earn sufficient income to educate his children, and improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is 54 years old. He is a farmer in the Philippines and has been in business for the past 20 years. He was fortunate to earn 10,000 PHP from his last crop harvest. He hopes to increase both his revenue and his crop yield in the future and is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Alfredo said he aims to improve his family's standard of living. Through his untiring work in the field, he hopes to sufficiently provide the necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Carolina operates an aluminum and glass shop. She handles finances, accounts, inventories, and promotion. She offers made-to-order aluminum doors and window glass and repairs any type of aluminum doors or windows that are referred to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 7,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales a week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 50, 000 PHP, which she will use to buy supplies like glass, aluminum materials, silicon, and other materials used in the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carolina hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a mother who is blessed with eight children. While doing the household chores, she finds time to help her husband manage their rice plantation in order to ensure that there is a good harvest. Despite the hardships in farming, they are able to endure because they want to earn and save to satisfy their needs and to support their children's needs. They would like to develop their farming business, but they have inadequate capital. Therefore, Maria is asking for additional capital of 25,000 PHP to buy seed, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay the labor costs required to plant. She believes that this loan will help them improve the business, and they hope that they will have a productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay the labor costs required to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 9 años de edad la misma que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de los padres.

Nuestra amiga es una joven madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y para que a su pequeña hija no le falte nada, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa ya que sus clientes llegan hasta este lugar a comprar sus productos, Trabaja cinco días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito, nos cuenta que le fue muy bien y que gracias a sus ganancias ella pudo comprar útiles escolares y uniformes, ya que su pequeña empezó un nuevo año escolar y que gracias a sus ventas ella pudo salir adelante, ya que eso para ella es lo más importante que a su hija no le falte nada, en los pagos nos cuenta que estuvo muy bien y que no tuvo ningún atraso. Este crédito es para seguir en su negocio ya que va a comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
P> 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every 15 days in Colorado, which is located in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. Most of the residents of this area engage in the manufacture of tagua buttons, handicrafts, and trade in general.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 33 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a nine-year-old daughter who is in school. Ana lives at her parents' house.

Since she is a young mother, Ana must earn her own income so that her daughter lacks nothing. She sells clothing of all types, as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door, but she also sells from her house since she has customers who will come to her place to buy the products. Ana works five days a week. She offers her products on credit and collects payments every week. Ana has been in this business for nine years and has been able to move her daughter forward.

Ana is repeating the loan process and says that she did very well. Thanks to the earnings she generated, she was able to buy a small amount of school supplies and uniforms for the new school year. Ana was able to get ahead as a result of her sales since it is very important to her that her daughter lack nothing. She says that she did very well with her payments and was never behind.

This loan will be used to continue her business by purchasing trousers, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other items. Ana is in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance the loans have given her in order to stay ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes habita con nieto de 13 años y se dedica a la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir usada como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, zapatos, etc. La señora  Mercedes es muy conocida en la zona   donde habita ya que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo honesta. Muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que ofrece variedad, calidad y buenos precios. Este negocio es muy importante para ella   ya que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos con la que cuenta.  Esto lo impulsa a estar muy atenta y muy pendiente del rumbo de su negocio, es decir, siempre está un paso adelante  de la competencia de tal forma que su negocio pueda llegar a ser muy conocido en la zona donde habita. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio  en la  compra de variedad de mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, shorts, camisetas, y de más prendas de vestir  que logren atraer a más clientes,  de tal forma de que  estos siempre encuentren lo que buscan y estén satisfechos con su servicio. De esta manera espera incrementar sus ventas  y mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her grandson who is 13 years of age. She sells a wide range of used clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants and shoes. She is well-known in the area where she lives as she is hard-working, responsible and above all honest. Many people prefer to buy her products as she offers variety, quality and good prices. 

This business is very important for Mercedes as it is one of her main sources of income. This has driven her to be very attentive and careful with how her business is doing - in other words, she is always one step ahead of the competition, ensuring that her business to be well-known in the area where she lives.

Mercedes has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of goods, such as pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, t-shirts and other clothing which will attract more customers. This will mean her customers will always find what they want, and will be satisfied with the service she offers. As a result, Mercedes hopes to increase her sales and improve her income, allowing her to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, blouses, shorts and t-shirts, among other items.

loans.name: Leoncio Daniel

texts.es:
Leoncio es un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho viajar y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el rico "Seco de Cabrito"; con mucho empeño terminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Mecánica Automotriz.   
Gracias a su deseo de salir adelante y con el apoyo de un buen amigo, Leoncio se dedica a trabajar en su negocio de transporte, pues gracias a que cuenta con un auto propio, él brinda servicios de taxi; el puede dedicarle un aproximado de 10 horas diarias a su negocio, Leoncio cree que su negocio marcha bien ya que conoce su recorrido y sabe las zonas donde puede encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros. 
Leoncio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento y reparación general de su auto, de esta manera podrá contar con un auto en buenas condiciones, ofreciendo así un mejor servicio para sus clientes, contribuyendo a incrementar sus ingresos para que en un futuro pueda adquirir otro auto para ser utilizado para trabajar.
texts.en:
Leoncio is an enterprising and very hard-working man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica. During his free time he loves to travel, and sometimes prepares one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Seco de Cabrito" (a stew made from young goat meat).

Leoncio worked hard to finish secondary school. Sadly, he was unable to go to university, but he would have liked to study to become a car mechanic. Thanks to his desire to get ahead and the support of a good friend, he works in a transport business. As he has his own car he offers taxi services, and can work for about ten hours each day. Leoncio thinks that his business does well because he knows the routes and in which parts of the city he can find the largest number of passengers. 

Leoncio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to perform maintenance and general repairs on his car. In this way he will have a car in good working condition, offering a better service to his customers. As a result this will help increase his income, so that he can buy another car for work in the future.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance and general repairs on his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit and buy dairy feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to start a retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar and purchase a sewing machine. The previous loan had a positive impact on her business. She made additional profits which enabled her to furnish her family house and she is now living in a comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase  bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar and purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anita Group

texts.en:
Anita is 43 years old and lives in Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban. Anita is married with 6 children. 

To earn a living, Anita has a business selling "banana cues" (fried bananas on a stick) in the local community. Anita earns about PHP 4,495 each month doing this type of work. Anita has requested a loan of 3,000  PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Anita would like to expand the business.

Anita is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a single woman with one kid who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and the high cost of transportation.

For the past two years, she has operated a cloth selling business, also selling charcoal as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Elnora dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Elnora joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Sammy is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to start a barber shop business. With the loan, he wants to purchase a hair-cutting machine for his business. He dreams of expanding his business to serve many customers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a hair-cutting machine for his business.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda y reside en el caserío Los Damianes ubicado en el distrito de Túcume caracterizado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de aganado ovino, ella cría su ganado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general, adicionalmente ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chica de jora  El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas, asimismo adquirir insumos para la elaboración de la chicha de jora, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, widowed, and resides in the village of Los Damianes, which is located in the District of Túcume. This area is known for its humble and hardworking people who engage in agriculture. This community is located in Lambayeque Province, which is more than 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María raises and sells sheep. The animals are kept in an area behind her house. When they have reached the right level of development, the animals are offered for sale to local traders and to the general public. In addition, María prepares and sells "chicha de jora" (a beverage made from corn). Her businesses enable her to cover her personal expenses and to help sustain her family financially.

María wants to acquire a few animals and balanced feed so that she can increase her sales. She will also buy supplies for making "chicha de jora". For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy animals, balanced feed, and supplies for making "chicha de jora".

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She married to Melchor, a plumber, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Julie earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the variety store, she has a bakeshop where different types of pastries and bread are sold. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and has 2 children. She is 28 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Philippines. Roselyn cultivates a gardening business for a living and she's been 6 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,420 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. 

In 2010, Roselyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Roselyn wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 47 years old and married with 5 children.

Diosdada works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "nipa" (woven palm mats) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Diosdada has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling "nipa" (woven palm mats) for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Diosdada aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She is from San Carlos, Tukuran. To make a living, Aurora sells specialty food products in the local community, which she has been doing for five year.  She earns 5,560 PHP a month. 

Aurora is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Aurora joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es un joven de 29 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que  se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se encuentran las líneas de nazca, las cuales son geoglifos ubicados en un extenso campo árido, las cuales según algunos estudios eran utilizadas como un calendario para saber la temporada de lluvias por la antigua cultura nazca. Raúl dese pequeño aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos y por ello el trabajaba para poder apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, debido a ello no pudo terminar de estudiar la secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria, Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Olluquito con charqui”; es por ello que él nos comenta que es mejor ser humilde pero trabajador y honrado porque su conciencia y su nombre siempre van a estar en lo alto.

Con mucho entusiasmo Raul se dedica a su negocio de venta de queso y de tunas, la cual es una fruta que crece en una planta parecida a un cactus, es muy deliciosa, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo amable y respetuoso con los clientes.

Raul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá construir su vivienda, ya que actualmente está hecha de esteras y ahora que estamos en la temporada de invierno, se siente mucho frio y sobre todo que no hay mucha seguridad, ya que es un material muy débil, de esta manera el tendrá una mejor vivienda y sobre todo mejorara su calidad de vida, así el podrá seguir luchando y trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande y terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Raul is a Young man of 29 years who lives in the city of Nazca, a city characterised for its warm climate. The Nazca lines are located there - they are geoglyphs found in a large arid plain, which according to some some studies were used as a calendar to predict the rainy season by the ancient nazca culture. 

Raul learnt to earn his living from the sweat of his brow from a very young age, since his parents did not have much money. He worked so that he could help his parents with the household expenses. For this reason he could not finish secondary school but he would have liked  to have studied at university. When he has free time he likes to listen to music and occasionally  he likes to eat one of his favourite dishes which is the delicious “Olluquito con Charqui.” He tells us that it is better to be humble but hardworking and honourable because his conscience and his name will always be clear. 

Raul takes great enthusiasm in his business of selling cheese and prickly pears (a fruit which grows on a plant which looks like a cactus, it is delicious). He works around 8 hours a day and can have up to 10 customers daily. He believes that his business is going well because he is very hard working and above all friendly and respectful towards his customers. 

Raul is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to construct a house because at the moment his house is made of rugs. It is now winter and he feels very cold and above all there is a lack of security, since it is a very fragile material. In this way he will have a better housing and above all will improve his quality of live. He will be able to continue fighting and working day to day to make his biggest dream come ture – to expand his business and finish building his house.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace 5 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí todos los días prepara en las mañanas el delicioso ceviche de pescado y por las noches ella vende fritadas (carne de chancho), todos esto acompañado de jugos, sodas u otras bebidas a preferencia de sus clientes. También con el crédito que recibe del banco ayuda a su esposo en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, él recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y nos cuenta que es la única forma de salir adelante trabajando los dos. 
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y pescado para sus platos y para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every 15 days in Colorado, which is located in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. Most of the residents of this area engage in the manufacture of tagua buttons, handicrafts, and trade in general.

Sra. Jessica lives in this place. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 9, and 5), all of whom are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Jessica helps her husband with the household expenses since he does not earn enough to cover everything. Five years ago, she started a small restaurant business in her home. Every day, she prepares delicious fish "ceviche" (marinated seafood) in the mornings. At night, she sells fried pork. All of her dishes are served with juices, sodas, or other beverages preferred by her customers. Jessica also uses the loans she receives from her Communal bank to help her husband with his business. He sells fish and travels around the city to offer his products. Jessica says that the loans are the only way for the two of them to continue working.

This loan will be used to buy provisions for the dishes she prepares, as well as fish for her restaurant and for her husband to sell. She has been with her Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the assistance the loans have given her. Her goals are to move forward in her business and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy provisions and fish.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe Group

texts.es:
Este es el segundo crédito de Doña Leticia, está microempresaria tan exitosa, jefa de hogar y excelente madre, nos cuenta que el financiamiento que le brindaron fue de mucha ayuda para ella y sus compañeras del grupo. 
Ella pudo invertir en mercadería para la temporada navideña, y obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, que le permitieron  alcanzar una de las metas que se había propuesto a mediano plazo, que es la compra de un automóvil para facilitar la venta y cobro de sus productos, así como el traslado de su hijo con discapacidad a terapias y visitas al doctor.
Para este préstamo ella va invertir en lo mismo, ropa, lencería y cosméticos, y con la misma motivación tiene toda la seguridad que su negocio va seguir creciendo. 
El grupo de doña Leticia está compuesto por 8 socias más, que fueron muy responsables, organizadas y comprometidas, ellas también desarrollan actividades comerciales y de servicios.
texts.en:
This is Leticia’s second loan.  She is a very successful small businesswoman, the head of her household, and she is an excellent mother.  She says that the loan that was given was a great help to her and her colleagues in the communal bank.

She was able to invest in merchandise for the Christmas season.  She got a lot of good earnings, which allowed her to reach one of the medium term goals she had set.  She bought an automobile to facilitate the sales and collections for her products.  She also uses the automobile to transport her disabled son to therapies and doctor’s visits.

She will use this loan in the same way.  She will buy clothes, lingerie, and cosmetics.  With the same motivation she is completely sure that her business will continue to grow.

Leticia’s communal bank is comprised of eight other members.  They are very responsible, organized, and committed.  They also develop commercial business activities and services.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lingerie, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She has a business that makes hollow building blocks in the Philippines.

Evangeline has requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business, which she has been in  for 10 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her building block manufacturing business

loans.name: Maria Yanina

texts.es:
María tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su pareja, su suegra y su menor hijo en su vivienda  de material rustico y de corte tradicional.  Actualmente se encuentra embarazada de su segundo hijo.  Su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el Caserío Las Pampas en Mórrope.
María en la parte posterior de su casa tiene corrales en los cuales cría  animales menores tales como pavos, patos, pollos, etc. también cría ganado caprino y ovino,  los cuales engorda con alimento balanceado, y cuando estos alcanzan peso y tamaño ideal los vende.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.
María desea engordar más rápido a su ganado para poder venderlo, es por eso que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, lo cual será invertido en compra de alimento para animales con fines de engorde, y así con los ingresos que perciba poder mejorar la calidad de vida tano de él como de sus hijos.
Presenta buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her partner, her mother-in-law, and her young son in a traditional-style home made of rustic materials. María is currently pregnant with her second child. Her home is located in the village of Las Pampas in Mórrope.

María raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, and other livestock in pens that are located behind her house. She also raises goats and sheep, which are fattened with a diet of balanced feed. The animals are sold once they reach the ideal size and weight. With the earnings she generates, María is able to cover her expenses and those of her family.

María wants her animals to gain weight faster so that she can sell them. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. The money will be invested in the purchase of feed for her animals so that they will gain weight. With her profits, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her children. María has good personal references.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 33 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, él es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el riquísimo Picante de Carnero; con mucho empeño Carlos concluyó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria.
Con muchas ganas de salir adelante y el deseo de progresar, Carlos trabaja como chofer de taxi, él dedica un aproximado de 12 horas diarias a su trabajo, en las cuales puede atender gran cantidad de clientes, él cree que le va bien en su trabajo debido a su amabilidad y buen trato hacia sus clientes.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayudada brindada podrá realizar el remodelado y pintado de su casa, para que ésta tenga mayor comodidad y mejor apariencia, favoreciendo de esta manera a que Carlos viva en un ambiente más armonioso y alegre, contribuyendo a mejorar su deseo de lograr sus metas y su sueño de tener un vehículo propio para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old, single, and lives in the City of Chincha.  He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking man who likes to listen to music and prepare on of his favorite dishes, delicious Picante de Carnero in his spare time.  Carlos completed his high school education after much effort.  Unfortunately he was not able to attend university due to lack of resources.

Carlos works as a taxi driver and has a grand desire to get ahead.  He works approximately 12 hours a day and serves many customers.  He believes that things are going well because of his friendliness and the good service he gives his customers.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to this assistance he was able to upgrade and paint his house so that it is more comfortable and looks nicer, allowing him to live in a more loving and happy  environment, which contributes to his motivation to achieve his goal of having his own work vehicle.

loans.use: to remodel and pain his home.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 46 years old and has seven children. Lilian is married and has two children who are in school.

Lilian is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilian has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilian has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and she has borrowed two times from NWTF in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Flor Cecilia

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 50 años, natural de la ciudad de Cañete, distrito de Imperial, ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella, los otros 2 son profesionales e independientes, Flor siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada por completo a sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella siempre ha luchado por ellos, ha trabajado como empleada en casas de playas y condominios, con cuyos pagos pudo juntar el dinero necesario para poner en marcha su negocio.
Desde hace 4 años, Flor puso en marcha su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella incursionó en este negocio ya que tiene buenas habilidades para las ventas, ella se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que cada día tiene más clientes y puede abastecer mejor su negocio.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de más mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, artículos de bazar y otros, de esta manera podrá abastecer mejor su negocio y con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tener más clientes, contribuyendo así a que en un futuro no muy lejano su negocio se convierta en un bazar donde venda desde abarrotes, regalos hasta artículos de escritorio y con ello espera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, para ella y sus hijos ya que por el afecto e inmerso amor que siente nunca dejará de ser madre.
texts.en:
Flor, 50, is a native of the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial.  She is a single mother with 3 children, of which only 1 lives with her.  The other two are professionals and independent.  Flor has always been a hardworking woman who is completely dedicated to helping her children get ahead.  She has always fought for them, she has worked as an employee in beach houses and condominiums, and with this pay she was able to save enough money to start up her business.

Four years ago, Flor started up her business selling groceries.  She launched this business because it has the ability to generate good sales.  She feels very comfortable with her work, because every day she has more customers and is better able to stock her store.

Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing, she will be able to carry out her plans to buy more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, consumer products, and other items.  In this way she will be able to better stock her store, increase her income and have more customers, thus contributing to the near future when she will convert her business into a general store where she sells groceries, gifts, and office supplies.  This way, she hopes to have a better quality of life for herself and her children, because with the great love and affection feels for them, she will never stop being their mother.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, consumer products and other items

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Sussan de 21 años es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Hace más de 02 años que  Sussan se dedica a la venta de frituras y bebidas.  Ella  comenzó este negocio gracias a su madre quien fue quien la motivo a emprender su propio negocio. También ofrece productos de belleza, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Gracias a dichas actividades Sussan ha podido apoyar a su pareja en la educación de sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como papa, aceite, limón etc. Sussan tiene como meta comprar su propio terreno, ya que actualmente vive alojada en casa de su madre. Sussan es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “La Rosa De Guadalupe” la cual está conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado, pues hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Sussan, age 21, has a life partner and two minor children.  Sussan has been selling fried food and drinks for two years.  She started this business thanks to her mother, who motivated her to undertake her own business.  She also sells beauty products, which gives her an extra income for her household. 

Thanks to these business activities, Sussan has been able to help her life partner with the children’s education.

She is now requesting the loan to buy supplies like potatoes, cooking oil, and limes, etc.

Sussan’s goal is to buy her own land because she now lives in her mother’s house.  Sussan is a member of the “La Rosa De Guadalupe” (The Rose Of Guadalupe) communal bank.  The bank is comprised of seven responsible and hard-working members.  They are grateful for the loan that was given; it makes their progress possible.

loans.use: to buy supplies like potatoes, cooking oil, and limes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es: Maria vive en Duran en el sector conocido como El Recreo. Tiene 38 años de edad y está casada con Eulogio con quien tiene 2 hijos. Su esposa tiene 5 años trabajando como guardia de seguridad en una urbanización privada. Sus hijos son menores de edad y se encuentran estudiando el ciclo básico. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de comidas y preparación de tortas en su vivienda.  Maria nos cuenta que empezó de muy joven por su padre, quien se dedicaba a este negocio. Él fue quien le enseño el trabajo ayudándole en la preparación y atención de los clientes. Fue su mejor profesor de vida ya que le enseño la responsabilidad y la independencia. Gracias a esto ahora puede ayudar a su esposo en el hogar. Nos cuenta que realiza sus ventas solo por pedidos a amigas, familiares y particulares. Con el crédito va a comprar ingredientes para la preparación de los platos y dulces. En cuanto a sus metas espera continuar su trabajo como lo está haciendo para ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria lives in Duran in a neighborhood known as El Recreo.  She is 38 years old and is married to Eulogio, with whom she has 2 children.  Her husband has been working as a security guard for 5 years in a private development.  Her children are minors, and are in elementary school.  She has a business selling food and making cakes in her house.  Maria tells us that she started when she was very young working for her father, who also had this business.  He was the one who taught her the work, and she helped him prepare the food and serve the customers.  He was her best life teacher, because he taught her responsibility and how to be independent.  Thanks to this, she is now able to help her husband with the household.  She tells us that she makes her sales based on orders from friends, relatives and individuals.  With this loan, she is going to buy ingredients to make her dishes and sweets.  As for her goals, she hopes to continue to work as she has been doing, so that she can offer better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and food coloring

loans.name: Genevev

texts.en:
Genevev is 31 years old and married with five children.

Genevev works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Genevev has borrowed and paid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Genevev aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
To make a living, Nely has been engaged in corn production for ten years. She is also engaged in her sari-sari (general) store based in her home. 

She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poor living. Nely is still single. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she had been able to provide for her personal needs. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production.

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Regalada works hard to support her family.

She has a watch repair business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. Regalada is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her watch repair business.

Regalada has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living from her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been fattening pigs for 11 years and also earns some additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Isabel del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Lidia se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como: pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, etc., así también cría ganado caprino y porcino, en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Lidia es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 32-year-old mother who resides with her three children in the Santa Isabel sector of the District of Mórrope. This agricultural district is located in Lambayeque Province, which is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lidia raises and sells small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. She also raises goats and pigs that are kept in a pen located behind her house. The animals are fed a diet of grains and natural grasses. Once they reach the correct level of development, the animals are offered for sale to the traders who frequently visit the area where she lives.

Lidia wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that she can expand her business and generate better income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,500 PEN to help accomplish this goal. Lidia is an industrious and hardworking person. Her greatest wish is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Lisset Christina

texts.es:
Lisset es una joven d e21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, su rica comida, asimismo en esta ciudad encontramos a las “Islas Ballestas”, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en todo el año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón. Lisset es una joven muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  Enfermería.

Día a día Lisset trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas gaseosas y cerveza, ella trabaja alrededor d e10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque los clientes ya la conocen.

Lisset está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como conservas de atún, bebidas gaseosa, menestras, arroz, azúcar por saco, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día  con día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermeria Tecnica”
texts.en:
Lisset is a young woman of 21 who lives in the city of Pisco, known for its beautiful beaches, rich food, and as the city where we find the “Isles of Springs,” visited by many tourists all year round. Also, agriculture is important, especially cultivating cotton. Lisset is a hard-working young woman, but when she has a little time off she likes to listen to music and, on occasions, to eat one of her favorite dishes, which is the tasty “Chicken with Garlic.” She only completed secondary school, but she would have liked to study nursing.

Day after day, Lisset works in her store selling groceries, soft drinks, and beer. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve as many as 35 customers in a day. She thinks her business is doing well, due to her pleasantness and, above all, because her customers have gotten to know her. 

Lisset is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, their help enables her to order more merchandise for her business, including canned tuna, soft drinks, vegetable stews, rice, and sugar by the sack, among other items. Thus, by this means, she can have more product variety and improve her income, allowing Lisset to continue struggling day by day to make her grandest dream a reality: to be able to study for a career in Technical Nursing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (canned tuna, soft drinks, vegetable stews, rice, and sugar by the sack, among other items.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 54 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, the Philippines. She has a child who is now in college. Luzviminda has managed to support her child's schooling and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Luzviminda earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them bit by bit for a profit. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Luzviminda dreams of being able to financially support her child through college. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime works hard to support his family. He is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jaime requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Jaime has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
