This is Vilma, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She has been separated from her husband, but by the grace of God, she was able to send three of her children through college (they are now working), and currently two children are in high school. She, together with her older children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a meat stall. She buys meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective markets and vendors. Her products are pork, beef, and other meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and beef needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Vilma hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to have a happy home. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional meat supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Junibeth

texts.en:
Junibeth is 30 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Junibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Junibeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc. 

In the future Junibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Balme

texts.en:
Balme is 42 years old and married with 5 children.

Balme works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Balme has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from rice and charcoal retailing.

Balme aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Nezel

texts.en:
Nezel is 32 years old and married with 3 children who are in school, Nezel works very hard to provide for them.

Nezel runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Nezel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and from a general store.

In the future, Rosela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 51 years old, married and has four children. Three of them attend school and the eldest child works abroad to help her family financially in times of need. Wilma is raising pigs to sell as her business and her husband is a farmer. Currently, Wilma has insufficient funds to sustain her pigs and she wants to ensure they receive good nutrition so she has applied for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed and medicines for her pigs. She hopes to sell her pigs at a higher price for additional profits.

With continuous effort, hard work and patience, Wilma hopes to give her children the best education possible and achieve a fortunate life someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 50 years old, married and has four children. Two of them attend high school and the rest have settled into marriage. 

Aurelia is running a small store to acquire income for their sustenance. She sells grocery items and earns about PHP 5,000 monthly. Her earnings go for daily meals and allowances for their children. 

She would like to increase her sales so she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of merchandise to sell. She will buy milk, coffee, sugar, breads, and eggs.

Aurelia hopes to achieve a good income from the business and continuously pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, sugar, breads, and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nube Azucena

texts.es:
Nube es una mujer trabajadora de 61 años. Vive en el sector norte de Guayaquil más conocido como Las Orquídeas. 
A su edad Nube tiene una profesión muy interesante la cual es la fotografía. Inicio este trabajo hace 10 años cuando fotografiaba eventos de familiares, como se dio cuenta que le iba bien decidió especializarse. El trabajo lo realiza sola y por contrato cuando le solicitan los servicios, lo realiza de esta manera ya que así disminuye sus riesgos de que no le vallen a pagar. Al momento ella se encuentra separada de su esposo y sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. El crédito que solicita lo va a utilizar para comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa. Espera con esto poder hacer un local para montar su estudio y brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Nube, 61 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives in the northern sector of Guyaquil, better known as Las Orquídeas ("The Orchids"). Nube has a very interesting profession for her age: she is a photographer. She started 10 years ago taking pictures at family events; since she realised she was doing well, she decided to become a specialist. She works alone and on a contractual basis when her services are asked for. She does this to diminish the risk of not getting paid. At the moment, she is separated from her husband; her 3 children are adults and independent. She will use the loan she asks for to buy construction materials to repair her house. She hopes to be able to build a room that would house her studio and thus offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and stone.

loans.name: Leida Yolanda

texts.es: Leida tiene 55 años de edad y vive en Libertad. Está casada con Cirilo quien es jubilado por discapacidad, tiene un taxi el cual lo trabaja su hijo mayor ganado una comisión por carreras. Al momento no tienen hijos ya que todos son mayores de edad. Hace 6 años, al jubilarse su esposo, decidió abrir el bazar en su domicilio. En sus inicios se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo vendiendo a familiares y amigos visitando sus casas o lugar de trabajo. Poco a poco fue ganando clientela y como tenía que ocuparse del hogar decidió quedarse en un lugar fijo. Su negocio lo abre en días laborales desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Leida nos comenta que en su negocio no a tenido problemas con la delincuencia ya que se encuentra en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. El préstamo lo va a emplear en la compra de productos varios y papelería con el fin de incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Leida is 55 years old and lives in Libertad. She is married to Cirilo, who is retired due to disability. He has a taxi, which is driven by their oldest son,  who workis on comission by the ride. They presently have no dependent children because they are all adults. 
Six years ago, when her husband retired, she decided to open a stationery shop in her home. Initially, she had been selling cosmetics by catalogue, visiting friends and relatives' homes and workplaces to make her sales. Her customer base gradually increased and, since she had to take care of her home, she decided to stay in one location.
Her business is open on workdays from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. Leida says her business hasn't had any crime problems, since it is located in a downtown area of the city. 
She is going to use the loan to purchase assorted products and stationery in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed animals, notebooks.

loans.name: Delia Robertina

texts.es: Delia nació y vive en Portoviejo, ciudad costera que pertenece a la provincia de Manabí. Tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de especias. Se encuentra casada con Ricaurte quien es sastre y también se dedica a la venta. No tienen hijos menores pero los acompaña Jaime su nieto de 10 años a quien le dan el estudio en la escuelita del barrio. Delia nos cuenta que la incursión en el comercio fue hace 21 años, cuando se caso con su esposo. Como el ya se dedicaba a esto le enseño para que le ayudara, le gusto mucho sobre todo porque le dejaba buenos ingresos. Juntos salen a recorrer varios sectores de Portoviejo sin ningún tipo de horario, lo que si mantienen es una ruta por su seguridad ya que así no ingresan en sectores peligrosos. Con el crédito comprara productos como canela, pimienta, comino. El deseo más ferviente de Delia es tener una tienda propia fija para no tener que seguir recorriendo sectores y así su esposo descanse.
texts.en: Delia was born and lives in Portoviejo, a coastal city that is in Manabí province.  She is 52 years old and she has a business selling spices.  She is married to Ricaurte, who is a tailor and also a merchant.  They don't have any minor children, but they live with their grand-child Jaime, who is 10 and studies at the neighborhood school.  Delia tells us that she started in retail trade 21 years ago, when she married her husband.  As he was already in this line of work, he taught her so that she could help him.  She liked it very much, most of all because it was giving her good earnings.  Together they go out around the various neighborhoods of Portoviejo without a fixed schedule.  They do maintain a fixed route, for reasons of security, because they don't want to go into dangerous neighborhoods.  With this loan, Delia will buy products such as cinnamon, pepper and cumin. Delia's most fervent wish is to have her own store, because then she wouldn't have to go out into the neighborhoods to sell, and her husband could rest.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, pepper and cumin

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
La señora Ayda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 48 años quien desde hace 13 años tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías y poco a poco fue mejorando el negocio. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería para el negocio principalmente granos básicos y su meta es comprar una camioneta para el negocio. 
Ayda tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 18 años es el que está a su cargo y quien está estudiando una carrera técnica.
texts.en: Ayda is a hardworking, enterprising, 48-year-old woman who has had a grocery store for the last 13 years; she started it selling snacks and gradually improved the business.  She will use the loan for merchandise for the business, mainly basic grains.   Her goal is to buy a pick-up truck for her business.  Ayda has four children but only the youngest, 18, who is studying a technical career is still in her care.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to improve her business. She supports her family and provides for their household needs through raising pigs. 

Teresita is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. Three of them are married while the other two have just finished their degree courses. She has been raising pigs for five years. Teresita plans to use her loan to buy feed and vaccines to be able to ensure the proper growth of her pigs.

Teresita hopes for her family to be healthy. In addition, she hopes that her business will continue to grow so she can gain more profits to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines to ensure the proper growth of her pigs

loans.name: Marlis Elizabeth

texts.es: Marlis tiene 44 años de edad y vive en las Orquídeas. En su casa abrió una venta de ropa y cosméticos para la mujer. Nos cuenta que empezó el comercio a raíz de la separación que tuvo de su esposo. Fueron tiempos difíciles ya que era ama de casa y no trabajaba, su esposo era el que mantenía el hogar. Ante la necesidad y como no encontraba empleo decidió invertir un dinero que tenía guardado comprando ropa para vender. También se suscribió a una compañía de ventas por catalogo para tener más que ofertar. Escogió ambas actividades porque es factible el horario ya que empieza desde las 8:30 hasta las 16:00 así se dedica a sus hijos el resto de la tarde. Tiene 2 niños de 13 y 6 años de edad quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal del barrio. En su trabajo de momento no a tenido mayores dificultades con respecto a la delincuencia y espera continuar de esa manera. El préstamo lo va a emplear en la compra de cemento, hierro y arena con lo que terminara de construir su casa. Como meta personal Marlis quiere ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente y en su negocio llagar a ser líder de ventas en su grupo de cosméticos.
texts.en: Marlis is 44 years old and lives in Las Orquídeas ("The Orchids"). In her house, she opened a shop that sells women's clothes and cosmetics. She tells us that she started her business after separating from her husband. Those were difficult times, since she was a housewife and did not work, her husband being the sole supporter of the household. Faced with necessity, and not finding a job, Marlis decided to invest a sum of money she had set aside and bought clothes to sell. She also subscribed to a company that sells through catalogues in order to have more to offer. She chose both activities because the hours were compatible: she works from 8:30 to 16:00 and thus can take care of her children the rest of the afternoon. She has two children of 13 and 6 years old who go to the state-run school in the neighbourhood. She has not had major trouble with criminal activity until now and she hopes this will continue. She will use the loan to buy cement, iron, and sand in order to finish building her house. Her personal goals are to see her children succeed professionally and her cosmetics business become the best-selling one amongst those who subscribe to the same catalogue company.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonía II lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es Martha Lorena de 43 años quien tiene una pulpería además vende tortillas, verduras y cerdo. Ella tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatros son menores de edad de 13, 10, 7 y 8 años los cuales estudian y en el tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio.
Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años con la realización de pozol y tiste con el tiempo gracias a su esfuerzo y los préstamos fue invirtiendo en otros productos como la venta de chatarra. El crédito lo invertirá en productos para el negocio principalmente granos básicos y su meta es lograr tener un supermercado como el PALÍ. 

Las otras integrantes son Claudia de 28 años quien tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles, cuajada y leña, Devora de 24 años realiza nacatamales, frijoles y tortilla; y Estela vende carne y verduras.
texts.en:
The “Armonía II” (Harmony II) group is composed of four hardworking, enterprising women.  The group coordinator is Martha Lorena, 43, who has a grocery store; she also sells tortillas, vegetables and pork.  She has five children four of which are minors aged 13, 10, 7 and 8 years who attend school and in their free time help her in the store.

She started the business 10 years ago making and selling pozol and tiste [traditional beverages made from cornmeal and cacao] and in time, thanks to her effort and loans, invested in other products like selling scrap metal.  She will use the loan to buy products for the business, mainly basic grains.  Her goal is to have a supermarket like a PALÍ mart.

The other group members are Claudia, 28, who has a tortilla shop and sells beans, cheese and firewood; Devora, who makes nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales] and Estela who sells meat and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: На протяжении 15 лет Султон занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Султон в основном выращивает картошку, пшеницы и ячмень. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. В бизнесе помогает его любящий сын. Султон старается улучшить свои жилищные условия и с этой целью обращается к вам за помощью. Султон хотел бы получить займ для покупки окон и дверей и ремонта своего дома. Султон надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: For 15 years, Sulton has been growing produce. He is married and raising four children. His wife is a homemaker. Sulton mainly grows potatoes, wheat and barley. In addition, he raises livestock. His loving son helps him in the business. Sulton is trying to improve his living condition, and this is why he is turning to you for help. Sulton would like to obtain a loan to buy windows and doors and renovate his house. Sulton is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to do home repairs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a 55-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She has provided the needs of her 5 children from the little amount of 8,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her fish vending business for 12 years. Her business is an aid to the income earned by her husband who does fishing. However, this year she joined GDMPC and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Lilia wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is married and works hard to support her family. She has a upholstery business in the Philippines, which she has run for 32 years.
Santas has requested a loan of 49,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials such as foam, leather and fabrics for her upholstery business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as foam, leather and fabrics for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. 
To make a living, Jeanne runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Jeanne has run her business for ten years and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Jeanne is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She joined Kiva partner GDMPC recently. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 59 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Luzminda runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 
In the future Luzminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is married and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.
Conception has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients to make food to sell. She has been in this business for ten years now, and earns additional income from her general store.
In the future, Conception would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old lady. She is a widow with one child who is eight years of age. She operates a dairy farming business and she sells soaps as a secondary business. She has been in the soap-vending business for four years and her monthly income is KES. 29,000.


This is her first loan from KADET LTD which she will be use to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to use her increased income to open a retail shop. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Erika Elizabeth

texts.es: Desde Milagros les presentamos a Erika. Tiene 25 años y está casada con Luis quien se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene una niña de un compromiso anterior que asiste a la escuela fiscal. Inicio la tienda por la necesidad de tener otros ingresos para así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su esposo actual fue el que la apoyo para que la abriera y como está en su domicilio puede cuidar de su hija sin problemas. De ya han pasado 3 años, en la actualidad tiene también un pequeño bazar el cual abre todos los días. Erika nos comenta que su mayor problema es la delincuencia ya que vive en un lugar un poco desolado. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos para la venta como cuadernos, plumas, cartulinas esperando que en la época estudiantil sus ventas mejoren. Su meta es incrementar la tienda y mantener a su familia unida y con buena salud.
texts.en: Allow us to introduce you to Erika from Milagros. She is 25 years old and is married to Luis, who works in agriculture. Erika has a daughter from a previous marriage who goes to state-run school. Erika started her shop because she needed extra income in order to be able to help her husband with household expenses. Her current husband is the one who helped her set it up, and, since the shop is in their house, she can look after her daughter easily. The business is already 3 years old. She now also owns a small general store, which she opens every day. Erika tells us that her biggest problem is criminal activity, since she lives in a slightly desolated place. With the loan, she will buy supplies to sell such as notebooks, pens, and cardboard folders, with the hope of seeing her sales increase with the school season. Her goals are to make her shop grow and to keep her family united and healthy.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and cardboard folders to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bakery supplies.

loans.name: El 13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo El 13 lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Andrea de 56 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos mayores. Ella tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, negocio que inicio hace 10 años actualmente tiene una muchacha que le ayuda. El crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos para seguir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son Silvia quien vende sandalia, chinelas y productos Avon y Marisol quien vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “El 13” (The 13) group is formed by three hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Andrea, 56, who is a widow and has five adult children.  

She has a ‘fritanga,’ a popular food stand selling fried fast-food.  She started the business ten years ago and currently employs a young woman to help her.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains to continue forward.  

The other group members are Silvia who sells sandals, slippers and Avon products and Marisol who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa de Guadalupe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Liseth quien comercializa desde fresco, hielo, boli y chocobanano…etc. este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años con su primera refrigeradora realizando helados y cuando compro un frízer empezó a vender otros productos. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de otro frízer para empezar a vender bebidas.
Las otras integrantes  son Martha de 49 años quien vende ropa desde hace 8 años, Claudia vende facturas comerciales y recargas desde hace 6 años y José Ángel quien vende ropa desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The group "Rosa de Guadalupe" consists of four hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Liseth, who sells soft drinks, ice, ice pops, chocolate-covered bananas, and other items. She started this business five years ago with her first refrigerator for making frozen treats. Liseth also bought a freezer because she wanted to sell other products. She will invest her loan in the purchase of another freezer so that she can start selling beverages.

The other members are as follows: • Martha is 49 years old and has been selling clothes for eight years. • Claudia has been selling commercial invoices and rechargeable phone cards for six years. • José Ángel has been selling clothes for seven years.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Agricultores Capellania Iii Group

texts.es:
El señor Macario Alejandro esta soltero, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de papas tipo Icta Frit, inicio este trabajo sembrando en el terreno de su padres y hasta el momento lleva 16 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas y también el fertilizante necesarios para que su productos sea, con buena ganancia, espera en el futuro tener mayor extensión de terreno para mas produccion. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al mismo trabajo, la siembra de papas tipo Icta Frit.
texts.en:
Macario Alejandro is 40 years old and single.  He has a sixth grade education.

He devotes himself to farming; he grows Icta Frit type potatoes.  He started this work by planting on his parents’ land.  So far he has 16 years of experience.

He organized a group to be able to request a loan.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, and he will also buy the fertilizer he needs so that his products give him good income.

In the future he hopes to have a greater extension of land in order to have more production.  

The rest of the members of the group devote themselves to the same work, growing Icta Frit type potatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josefina is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josefina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 64 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Mercedita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene en el Fortín una despensa ubicada en su casa que tiene en Flor de Bastión. Tiene 68 años y la idea de abrir la tienda nació por la necesidad de tener ingresos sin ninguna presión a su salud. Nos cuenta que a tenido mucha acogida ya que cuando la abrió no había competencia con lo que pudo atraer clientes los cuales no lo cambian por su forma de atenderlos. Está casado con Mariana quien trabajaba de empleada domestica pero en la actualidad es ama de casa y le ayuda en la tienda en las mañanas y noches. Como todos los sectores urbanos su barrio sufre con los inviernos y ese es su mayor problema ya que se inunda con lo que bajan sus ventas. Al momento sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Con el préstamo comprara arroz, azúcar, aceite por mayor para la distribución en su tienda. Le gustaría en un futuro comprar un carro para aumentar su negocio y poder mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has a store in Fortín which is inside his house that is situated in the neighborhood of Flor de Bastión.  He is 68 years old and came up with the idea for a store because he needed to earn income without putting any pressure on his health.  Luis says that his store has been well-received since it opened because of the lack of competition.  He is able to attract customers without having to change the way he serves them.  

Luis is married to Mariana, who previously worked as a housekeeper, but is now a homemaker and also helps with the store in the mornings and at night.  Like all of the other urban areas, his neighborhood suffers during the winter because flooding is a major problem that causes his sales to decrease.  His grown children are currently independent.  Luis will use his loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil in bulk so that he can distribute them from his store.  In the future, he would like to buy a car so that he can increase his business and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es: José tiene 59 años y vive en Quevedo. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos. Inicio su negocio con un capital pequeño aprendiendo la actividad de un cuñado. José nos comenta que en la elaboración se llevan a cabo una serie de procesos estándar que comprenden desde la elección del material arcilloso, al proceso de empacado final. La materia prima utilizada para la producción de ladrillos es la arcilla. Debido a la característica de absorber la humedad, la arcilla, cuando está hidratada, adquiere la plasticidad suficiente para ser moldeada, muy distinta de cuando está seca, que presenta un aspecto terroso. Lego de esto viene la fase de endurecimiento, por secado, o por cocción, el material arcilloso adquiere características de notable solidez con una disminución de masa, por pérdida de agua. En resumen el proceso es el siguiente. Maduración, depósito de materia prima procesada, humidificación, moldeado, secado, cocción, almacenaje. La exposición al aire, lluvia, sol, hielo favorece a la descomposición de la materia orgánica que pueda estar presente. Este trabajo requiere de mucha fuerza física por ese motivo José tiene problemas de hernia y de columna. A eso tambien se le suma que sufre problemas de presion ya que al momento de la cocion necesita manipular el horno el cual tiene que estar en una temperatura alta y adecuada para el preceso, como podemos ver en la imagen. Su esposa es ama de casa y tiene 6 hijos quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo comprar materia prima para aumentar su producción para poder terminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old and lives in Quevedo. He makes and sells bricks, and started his business with a small capital investment and learned the trade from his brother-in-law. 

Manufacturing the bricks involves a series of standard processes ranging from the choice of material to the final packaging process. The raw material for production of bricks is clay. Because of clay's ability to absorb moisture, when hydrated it gains sufficient plasticity to be shaped, which is very different from when it is dry and gains an earthy appearance. After this comes the stage of hardening, drying, or cooking, where the clay gains a remarkable strength with reduced mass due to water loss. In summary, the process is as follows: maturation, storage of the processed raw material, humidification, molding, drying, cooking, storage. Exposure to air, rain, sun, and ice accelerates the decomposition of organic matter. 

This work requires a lot of physical strength, which is why José has a hernia and problems with his spine.  José's wife is a housewife and has 6 children who attend public school. With this loan, he will purchase clay to increase production, and finish his home.

loans.use: to purchase clay

loans.name: Ntauwasa

texts.en:
Ntauwasa is a thirty-eight-year-old man. He is married and has three children. He is a pigs and crop farmer. He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase seeds for farming on his farm. With the profits, he will purchase more land for farming and expanding his pig business. 


In the future, he plans to buy more acres of land for large scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings for farming

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 45 years old business lady. She has been operating her business for a period of 13 years with an income  of KES. 40,000. She supports four people.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to improve her business by renovating the cafeteria. She hopes to be financially stable and cater for her family expenses.

loans.use: to improve her business by renovating the cafeteria

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio tiene 53 años de edad y reside junto a su esposa y a tres hijos en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Tambogrande de la región Piura. La zona se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo. El estilo de vida de los habitantes es bastante precario, aunque cuentan con algunos servicios básicos. 

Como la mayoría de pobladores del lugar, Arsenio se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña extensión de terreno agrícola en la cual siembra mango, adicionalmente también se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Con estos ingresos Arsenio trata de sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles el sustento diario. 

Arsenio desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder aplicarlos a su cultivo y lograr mejores cosechas. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles con los que planea lograr su objetivo. El ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa, pagándolos de modo puntual.
texts.en:
Arsenio, 53, lives with his wife and three children in Guaraguaos Alto, a rural agricultural zone belonging to Tambogrande in Piura Region.  The zone is located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.  Life style of residents is quite precarious there although some do have basic utilities.

Like most area residents, Arsenio works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel of farmland where he grows mangoes.  He also raises small farm animals which when they attain ideal size and weight he sells in the local market.  With this income Arsenio strives to move his family forward providing them with daily sustenance.

Arsenio wants to buy fertilizer to apply to his crops to attain better harvests. To do so, he’s requested a 1200 new sol loan he plans to use to reach his goal.  He’s had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans all of which he’s repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mariela Aracely

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años y vive en Libertad. Está casada y tiene una hija de 15 años a su cargo, sus otros hijos son mayores e independientes. Nos cuenta de su negocio el cual es una pequeña tienda, que la inicio gracias a los ahorros de su esposo quien trabaja de pescador. Su labor la realiza a diario atendiendo su local hasta las 10 de la noche. En su tiende tiene productos de venta diaria como arroz, legumbres, snack, víveres. Nos comenta que una de sus dificultades es cuando se enferma porque no tiene empleados y se ve en la obligación de cerrar con lo cual pierde sus ventas. Con el préstamo comprara su mercadería para surtir su negocio. Su meta futura es poder tener poco a poco su local de cemento ya que actualmente es de caña. Nos dice que con ayuda de Dios va a poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mariela is 40 years old and live in Libertad. She is married and has a 15-year-old daughter under her care. Her other children are adults and independent.

She talks about her business which is a small store that she started thanks to her husband's savings. He works as a fisherman. She carries out her work daily, attending to her store until 10:00 at night. She has daily needs items at her store such as rice, vegetables, snacks and other convenience store items. She says that one of her challenges is when she gets sick because she does not have employees and she must close which means she loses sales. 

She will buy merchandise to supply her store with this loan. Her goal for the future is to be able to have a cement store little by little as currently the store is made of cane. She says that with help from God she will be able to maker her dreams happen.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and convenience store items.

loans.name: Daniel Guillermo

texts.es: Desde Quevedo conocemos a Daniel. Tiene 30 años de edad y se encuentra soltero. Viven en la casa de sus padres en donde tiene un local de venta de helados y cyber. El negocio empezó como una idea que fue apoyada por sus padres. Nos cuenta que ellos son dueños de una escuela particular y como en verano no hay clases el centro de cómputo pasa inactivo. Así que decidió abrir un local y prestar las maquinas en el alquiler de servicio de computación. Además de eso en su local vende helados, snacks y accesorios de computadoras. El trabajo lo realiza solo todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Tiene 2 años con el local y de momento está satisfecho ya que a obtenido muy buenos resultados. Daniel nos indica que por el momento le está haciendo falta una impresora y a la vez escáner por lo que con el préstamo las piensa adquirir. Le gustaría a futuro ampliar el negocio para comprarse un carro.
texts.en: In Quevedo we meet Daniel.  He’s 30 years old, single, and lives in his parents’ home where sells frozen treats and has a cyber café.  He started the business as an idea that his parents supported.  He says that they own a private school and since there are no classes during the summer, the computer center remains inactive, so he decided to open a location and use the machines to rent out computer services.  He also sells ice cream, snacks, and computer accessories.  He works alone every day between 9:00 am and 8:00 pm.  He’s been doing this for two years in this location and he’s satisfied since he’s been getting good results.  Daniel says that he needs a printer and a scanner and plans to buy them with the money from this loan.  In the future he wants to expand his business so that he can buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a printer and scanner.

loans.name: Wimper Arnulfo

texts.es: Wimper vive en el Guasmo sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. A sus 53 años atiende su local en el cual vende víveres y panes ubicado en su domicilio. El negocio lo empezó hace 8 años atrás y lo empezó principalmente por que por su domicilio no había tienda en esos momentos. En la actualidad su realidad es distinta porque tiene competencia. Nos comenta que como a todo negocio la competencia no favorece ya que bajan las venta, sin embargo a los clientes si porque tienen donde elegir. Wimper nos comenta que esto también hace que mejoren el trato y las promociones para llamar la atención. Su secreto indica es el tiempo de la atención por eso el abre a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 11 de la noche. Esto lo hace ya que se dio cuenta que muchos padres compran el lunch que llevan los niños a la escuela a diario. Claro que al cerrar tan tarde esta propenso a la delincuencia y como trabaja solo se vuelve vulnerable en este aspecto. Wimper es separado y sus hijos son independientes pero viven con él. Con el préstamo comprara productos para aumentar el stock de inventario. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio o abrir otro en centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Wimper lives in the Guasmo sector in an urban area south of Guayaquil.  He is 53 years old, and he sells food and bread from his place at his house.  He started the business eight years ago.  He started primarily because there was not a store around his house at that time.

Now it is different because he has competition.  He tells us that like all businesses, the competition does not help because sales go down.  Nevertheless, it helps the customers because they are able to choose.

Wimper tells us that this also makes the service improve, and there are specials to get customer attention.  He indicates that his secret is the time that he spends at the store.  He opens at 5 in the morning and closes at 11 at night.

He does this because he realized that a lot of parents buy lunch that the children take to school every day.  Clearly, by closing so late he is subject to delinquency.  Because he works alone he is prone to this delinquency.

Wimper is separated, his children are independent, but they do live with him.

He will use the loan to buy products to increase his stock.  His dream is to increase his business or to open another in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy food, bread, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Mateito  (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mateito se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios que hasta la fecha tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lourdes, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Ella estudia laboratorio y está en un proyecto de tesis para graduarse como laboratorista. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.

Nuestra amiga es una joven muy activa que se dedica a sus estudios y para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto tener para los gastos de sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa, carteras, y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que ella además de vender por su localidad también vende en la universidad donde estudia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, gracias a esto ella ha podido salir adelante con su carrera universitaria.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, carteras y ropa.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener su laboratorio clínico.

La foto pequeña es una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Mateito” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Junín Canton, a place noted for its kind, hardworking people and because the best ‘aguardiente’ [an alcoholic beverage] in the province and in Ecuador is distilled here.

A group of people decided to join together in this place and to form this communal bank which will be of great use to them to improve the small businesses they have to date.  They carry out a variety of activities like commerce, services and food sales, among other activities.

We met Lourdes, 26, here.  She’s single and lives in her parents’ house.  She is studying laboratory and is in the thesis-writing phase leading to her graduating as a lab technician.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles.  She’s the Treasurer and likes it because the group is very united.

Our friend is a very active young woman who is dedicated to her studies and who in order to earn her own recourse to cover the cost of her studies sells clothes, purses and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works every day because besides selling around her neighborhood she also sells at the university she’s attending.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She’s been in this activity more than two years and does very well.  Thanks to this she’s been able to move forward with her university career.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, purses and clothes.  Her dream is to have a clinical laboratory one day.

The small photo is of a member who was unable to attend when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, purses and clothes.

loans.name: Jeaneza

texts.en:
Jeaneza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jeaneza has been in this business for two years. Jeaneza earns more income from fish vending and raising livestock.

Jeaneza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marcelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Marcelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net and paint for her fishing boat.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish net and paint for the boat.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with two children. Elma is 32 years old and lives at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Elma is operating a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. 

This year, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 50 years old, married and has five children. She is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 24 años, es un joven trabajador que vive en compañía de su madre, Ricardina.  
Él trabaja para sacar adelante a su madre, ya que su papa trabaja en otra ciudad y los visita una vez al mes. Es así que comenzó a estudiar y trabajar a la vez, durante la mañana sigue sus estudios universitarios de psicología y los fines de semana se dedica a tocar en una orquesta, pues desde muy pequeño aprendió el saxo. “En mis presentaciones gano muy bien, con ello puedo mantener mis estudios y ayudar en algunos gastos del hogar”, afirma. Su meta es ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un auto para trabajar como taxista, ya que los gastos de la universidad aumentaran conforme pasen los años. Sabe que lo logrará pues es un joven trabajador y muy inteligente. 

Pertenece al grupo solidario “Azapampa” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado, además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Jimmy invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 24 years old.  He is a hardworking youth who lives with his mother, Ricardina.

He works to support his mother, because his father works in another city and visits them once a month.  In this way he started to study and work at the same time.  In the morning he continues his university studies in psychology, and on the weekends he plays in an orchestra, as he's been playing the saxophone since he was very young.  "In my musical engagements I earn a lot, with which I can pay for my education and also help with some household expenses," he says.  His goal is to save enough to buy an automobile so he could work as a taxi driver, because his university expenses will increase over the years.  He knows that he will achieve this, because he is a hardworking youth who is very intelligent.

He belongs to the communal bank "Azapampa," and this his fourth loan from MFP.  He appreciates the support provided, and also promises to make his payments on time.  The members of his communal bank are responsible and supportive people.

Jimmy will invest the money he is requesting to pay for his studies at the university.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed mother of eight children, six of whom are attending school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Luvuno has run a goat meat business for the past three years, selling at the market to the general public.  Her dream is to open a shop in the future. Price fluctuation is a major challenge to her business. She joined Yehu to get access to funds to boost her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

With the loan of KES 40000, she will be able to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla es una mujer con 34 años de edad, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos. Se dedica a su actividad desde hace varios años. Ella vió la necesidad de generar ingresos sin descuidar a su familia, debido a que es jefa de hogar y tiene que satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Ella tiene un pequeño cuarto en donde tiene su horno industrial y realiza su trabajo. Cuenta con el apoyo de una tía para hacer sus productos y salir a venderlos.Ahora quiere invertir en materia prima y comprar moldes para ofrecer más variedad de repostería y asi superarse tanto a nivel personal como de negocio.
texts.en:
Karla is a 34-year-old woman and a single mother with four children. She has been in business for several years. Karla saw the need to generate income without having to neglect her family since she is the head of her household with an obligation to cover family necessities.

Karla has a small room where she keeps an industrial oven that she uses for her work. She has help from an aunt in making the products that she sells. Now she wants to invest in supplies and the purchase of baking tins so that she can offer a wider variety of baked goods. This will enable her to excel in her business and on a personal level.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for baking.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y sobre todo porque encontramos a uno de los atractivos turísticos como la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Nelly le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo y sabroso “Pollo a la Braza”.

Día a día Nelly trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado de su ciudad, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo honrada.

Nelly eta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería como su negocio como palta fuerte, ya que estamos en temporada de invierno y en estos meses tiene mucha acogida, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Nelly is a very hardworking woman living in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot climate and above all because a tourist attraction, the Hucachina Lagoon, is there.  Agriculture is common, especially growing cotton, grape and asparagus, among others.  When Nelly has free time available she likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious grilled chicken.

Day to day Nelly works in her business selling fruit in her city’s market.  She spends about nine hours daily at work and can see up to 30 customers per day.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to her customers and above all honest.

Nelly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise like avocadoes for her business because we are in winter season and they are very well-received during these months.  In this way she will be able to improve  her income and above all have a wide variety of products to offer her customers which will allow her to continue striving towards making her greatest dream a reality: to finish building her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (avocadoes)

loans.name: Denys Elsa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Denys tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya  mayores de edad y una de 17 años que estudian en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella instala un pequeño kiosco en el centro de la ciudad lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, también se desplaza hasta otras ciudades como Bahía y calceta lugar en los cuales ofrece sus productos, ella viaja en los días de ferias ya que es allí donde más personas llegan a estas ciudades. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Perú, Quito,  Guayaquil o Ambato y esto lo realza cada vez que necesita surtir su kiosco. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 13 años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Amistad Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic, with the majority of its residents working in agriculture and raising animals because it's an area with extensive vegetation.

Here we met Denys, 42.  She is married and has four children from this relationship, three of them adults and a 17-year-old daughter who is in school and still lives with her.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Our friend sells all types of clothing to earn something on her own so she can get ahead and help with the household expenses.  She sets up a small kiosk in the center of the city, where many merchants sells their products.  She also goes to other cities, such as Bahía and Calceta, to sell her products.  She travels on market days, when more people go to these cities.  She is going to buy her merchandise in Peru, Quito, Guayaquil, or Ambato, which she does every time she needs to supply her kiosk.  She has been doing this work for nine years and it is going very well for her.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for 13 years and she likes it because she began her business with one of her loans.

Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de cheff,el trabaja en un restaurant donde realiza platos tipicos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,tambien el socio se dedica al negocio de artesania,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de artesania y mejorar en su trabajo como cheff.El socio solicita el credito para comprar artesania como polos y chompas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the chef business.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. in a restaurant making traditional dishes.  He also works in the arts and crafts business.  He gets his son ahead with this business.  His dream is to expand his arts and crafts business and improve in his work as a chef.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like ceramics, sweaters, blankets, shirts, and many other items.

loans.name: Elena De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Elena de los Ángeles es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una refresquería y se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 15 años. Este negocio lo inicio su madre y ella continúo con el negocio en el cual invertirá el crédito en cosméticos, pollo y verduras.
Ella con el crédito anterior logro comprar un exhibidor y empezó a vender gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena de los Ángeles is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been managing a refreshments stand and selling cosmetics for 15 years. This business was started by her mother and she continues to manage it. She will invest this loan in cosmetics, chickens, and vegetables.

With her previous loan, Elena bought a display case and was able to start selling sodas.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, chickens, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jimena Xirey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jimena kirey lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rebeca Patricia quien inicio hace tres años vendiendo verduras con las ganancias empezó a invertir en azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, chiverías y pollo hasta tener una modesta y pequeña pulpería. El crédito lo invertirá en carne, granos básicos y verduras.
Las otras integrantes son Fátima quien tiene comideria y vende sopas y nacatamales; Azucena quien vende productos Avon y ropa; y Raquel tiene una venta desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The "Jimena Kirey" group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising individuals. One of them is Rebeca Patricia who started selling vegetables three years ago. With the earnings she began to buy sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, snacks and chicken, until she had a small, modest grocery store. She will use the loan to buy meat, staple grains and vegetables.

The other members are Fátima, who has an eatery and sells soups and nacatamales (Nicaraguan stuffed corn tamales), Azucena who sells Avon products and clothing, and Raquel who has been in sales for five years.

loans.use: To buy meat, staple grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Rubia Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Rubia es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le da el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y la belleza de la naturaleza, tiene una gran variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva a propios y visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rubia tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 24, 20, 15, 7 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y la ayudan económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Rubia goza de muy buena salud al igual que se encuentran todos los miembros de su familia. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos de varias marcas y también de embutidos, se encuentra en el negocio hace 5 años.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando mercadería para continuar en el negocio, en el pago de dicho crédito no ha tenido ninguna dificultad  y realizo la cancelación a la fecha. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para tener una mayor variedad de mercadería. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que existe en el grupo y por los créditos que le dan la oportunidad para continuar con el negocio.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the communal bank "Renacer Uncovia." She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its architectural beauty, for which it has been named a World Heritage Site. It has many places to visit and beautiful landscapes, it has a large variety of cuisine which interests both locals and visitors. The people are friendly, kind and still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns. 

Rubia is 45 years old, is married and has had five children of 24, 20, 15, 7 and 5 years old during her marriage. Her first two children work side by side with her and help her financially. Her third child is studying at college and her two youngest children are studying at a school in the city. She does not have her own house but is renting. 

Rubia enjoys good health, as do all the members of her family. She is a shop-keeper and earns her living selling clothes, cosmetics of various brands and also sausages. She has been carrying on this business for 5 years. 

She invested her previous loan in buying merchandise to continue with her business. She has not had any problem in repaying this loan and repayed it by the due date. She will invest this next loan in the purchase of cosmetics and clothes so that she can have a larger variety of merchandise. She likes the communal bank because of the cameradery which exists in the group and because of the loans which give her the opportunity to continue with the business. 

Her goal is to have  her own shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Herminda, tiene 76 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, aunque viven muy cerca de ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad.

Ella realiza el crédito para invertirlo en un taller de cerrajería que tienen en su casa con uno de sus hijos, nos cuenta que este negocio lo tenía su esposo pero que por motivos de enfermedad tuvo que dejar y ahora su hijo se hace cargo del trabajo y ella  recibe parte de las ganancias por la inversión que hace en los materiales y es con esto ella y sus esposo salen adelante, allí realizan muchos trabajos con el metal el aluminio y el vidrio, construyen pertas, ventanas, estructuras y varias cosas más, este taller lo tienen hace mas de 20 años en los cuales su esposo trabajaba y gracias a Dios siempre les ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras y pinturas para su taller. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado  a lo largo de este tiempo.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded in books as one of the indigenous towns that is part of the Manteña culture. This urban parish is situated only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province. It's a place full of history, where the members of the communal bank Maria Asuncion meet twice a month.

Here we meet Herminda, aged 76.  She is married, and has 9 children from this relationship.  All of her children are now adults and are independent, though they live quite close to her.  Her husband no longer works because he is ill.

Herminda is taking a loan to invest in a metal shop that she has in her house with one of her children.  She tells us that her husband had this business, but because of his illness he had to leave it.  Now her son is in charge of the work, and she receives part of the earnings based on the investment she makes in materials.  This is how she and her husband get by.  In the workshop, they do a lot of work with metal, aluminum and glass, building doors, windows, structures and a variety of other things.  She has had this workshop for more than 20 years.  Her husband worked in it, and thanks to God it always has done well.  

This loan will be used to buy iron, welding materials and paints for her workshop.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that they have given her over all of this time. 

Her dream is to continue to move forward.

loans.use: to buy iron, welding materials and paints

loans.name: La Margaritas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Margaritas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es la señora Mayra Rosa quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y calzado entre otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años y su meta es lograr poner una tienda surtida con variedad de productos.
Las otras integrantes son Rosa quien vende mechas de lampazo y Margarita quien vende gaseosas, frito, moronga, chicharrón y cerveza y su meta es volver a poner su panadería.
texts.en:
The "Margaritas" is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women. The coordinator is Mayra Rosa, who sells clothing, cosmetics, footwear and other products. She started this business seven years ago, and her goal is to manage to set up a store stocked with a variety of products.

The other members are Rosa who sells mop heads, and Margarita who sells soft drinks, fried foods, blood sausage, deep-fried pork rinds and beer; her goal is to set up a bakery again.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks for her store

loans.name: La Sagrada Familia - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
HAYDEE de 49 años de edad, es socia de la alcancía comunal La Sagrada Familia de la localidad de El Tambo y en la fotografía es la segunda de la izquierda viste con una casaca blanca y azul, es madre soltera, trabaja muy duro para poder sacar a delante a sus 02 hijos desde muy joven, logrando así que ellos estén estudiando en un Instituto Superior.
A ella la caracteriza el hecho de ser muy luchadora y trabajadora ya que ella tiene un pequeño negocio de postres (pasteles, mazamorras, etc.) y desde muy tempranas horas realiza las compras de sus insumos y los ofrece en el mercado de su localidad.
HAYDEE va invertir el préstamo obtenido en la compra de más insumos ya que como expende hace mucho tiempo sus productos, tiene muchos clientes que siempre le van haciendo pedidos especiales.
*En la parte superior derecha de la fotografía se encuentran la Sra. Sofia con casaca roja y la Sra. Miluska con chompa negra.
texts.en:
Haydee, 49, is a member of the “La Sagrada Familia” (The Holy Family) communal bank located in El Tambo.  In the photo she’s second from the left wearing a white and blue jacket.  She’s a single mother and has worked very hard since she was very young to be able to move her two children forward succeeding in having them attending an institution of higher learning.

She is noted for being very tenacious and hardworking since she has a small desserts business (cakes, 'mazamorra' [made from purple corn], etc.) and starting very early she makes her purchases of ingredients and sells her products in the local market.

Haydee will use the loan she’s gotten to buy more ingredients because she sold out long ago and she has many customers that always make special requests.

In the upper right part of the photograph, Sr. Sofia is shown with a red sweater and Sra. Miluska with a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Son cerca de 6 años que la Sra. Julia se dedica a la confección y venta de uniformes. Ella recuerda que desde muy niña le agrado la costura hizo cursos para aprender todo acerca de la confección, pero no lo ejerció  por dedicarse de lleno a su familia, ya después de algún tiempo se separo de su esposo y tuvo que empezar de cero endeudándose para comprar una maquina esto le costó muchas privaciones hasta que pudo montar un pequeño taller en su casa. Julia confecciona todo tipo de uniformes para diferentes colegios con su trabajo puede costear algunos gastos de la casa y ayudar  para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, lo que más desea es comprarse un local en gamarra (el centro de la moda en Lima Perú) para confeccionar ropa de mujer y vender directamente y de esa manera expandir su negocio, Julia es la presidenta de la alcancía “ LAS AMISTOSAS” con su préstamo quiere seguir invirtiendo en la compra de telas para la confección de uniformes.
*Julia es la primera de la derecha viste polo negro y lleva un maletin.
*En la imagen adjunta al lado derecho de la foto aparece la Srta. Karen.
texts.en:
Julia has been making and selling uniforms for about six years.  She remembers that she has liked sewing since she was a little girl.  She took courses to learn everything about making clothes, but she never practiced because she devoted herself full-time to her family.  Sometime later she separated from her husband and had to start at zero, getting in debt to buy a sewing machine.  She suffered great hardship until she was able to set up a small tailor shop in her house.

Julia makes all types of uniforms for different schools.  With her job she is able to pay for some of the household expenses and help her children get a good education.  What she most wants is to buy herself a store in Gamarra (the fashion center of Lima, Peru) to make women's clothing and expand her business by making direct sales.

Julia is the president of Las Amistosas Communal Bank.  With her loan she wants to continue to invest in buying fabric to make uniforms.

*Julia is the fifth one from the right, wearing a black t-shirt.
* The image on the right hand side is Sra. Karen

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Marjorie Raquel

texts.es: Marjorie de 35 años vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Milagro. Angel el esposo de Morjorie tiene 22 años desempeñándose como electricista en un taller. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela. Antes de tener su negocio trabajaba como dependiente pero el sueldo que recibía no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos, por ese motivo decidió abrir su tienda de abarrotes. Se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio y como nombre le puso “la Económica” vende productos de fácil distribución y que se consumen diariamente. Marjorie abre todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, abre temprano ya que tiene cliente en esas horas. Con el préstamo espera comprar arroz, azúcar, productos de limpieza etc., esperando mas ventas para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 35, and lives with her family in the city of Milagro. Angel, Marjorie's husband, has 22 years experience as an electrician in a workshop. She has two small children who go to school. 

Before having a business, she worked as a sales clerk, but the salary she received was not enough to cover her expenses. For that reason she decided to open her grocery store. It is located in her home, and she named it "La Económica”. She sells convenience products for daily use. 

Marjorie opens her store every day from 7:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night. She opens early as she has customers at that time of day. With the loan, she hopes to buy rice, sugar, cleaning products, etc., hoping for more sales so that her business grows.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cleaning products.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que cuidó sola de sus dos hijos: Iván y María; a los que educa y alimenta en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Azapampa.
Comenzó en la agricultura, pero con el tiempo aprendió el oficio del bordado de faldas y mantas típicas que utilizan las mujeres en las festividades. Su trabajo se incrementa los meses de junio y julio, aunque comenta que desde ahora se encuentra recibiendo muchos pedidos, por lo que ya no viaja a diversas ciudades a vender sus bordados. Además, en la actualidad se encuentra estudiando para aprender a realizar blusas y pantalones. Comenta que es una de las alumnas más aplicadas y responsables, ya está practicando, y dentro de poco comenzará a confeccionar y vender, pues hay mucha demanda de las prendas en la localidad. Aún no posee todas las máquinas que se requiere, pero poco a poco y con sus ahorros podrá completar su taller.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Azapampa” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado, además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues las integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Valeriana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina remalladora y telas para comenzar la confección de sus nuevas prendas.
texts.en:
Valeriana, 34, is a hardworking woman who raised her two children, Iván and María, by herself; she feeds and educates them in her own house located in Azapampa.

She started out in agriculture but in time learned the occupation of embroidering skirts and traditional fabrics women use in festivals.  Her work load increases in June and July although she comments that she’s been getting many orders since now so she doesn’t have to travel to other cities anymore to sell her embroidery.  In addition, she’s currently studying to learn how to make blouses and pants.  She comments that she’s one of the best, most responsible students.  She’s already practicing and in a short time will start to make and sell because there is high demand for the articles of clothing in her locality.  She still does not have all the machines she requires but little by little and with her savings she will be able to complete her workshop.

She belongs to the “Azapampa” group and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support provided and promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are responsible, supportive people.

Valeriana will use the requested money to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric to start making her new articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
Felisa tiene 34 años, está casada con Jhony y tienen tres hijos de una anterior pareja.
Ahora se siente contenta de haber encontrado un buen hombre, Jhony trabaja en una mina y como es lejos, vuelve a casa cada 3 meses. Mientras eso, ella se dedica a su tienda de comestibles, ya tiene 6 meses, sabe que es poco tiempo pero no se amilana, pues ya tiene buenos clientes. Pero su principal ingreso económico es la crianza de cerdos, los que compra de la ciudad, después los engorda y cuida hasta poder venderlos a un mayor precio a los carniceros del mercado más grande de su ciudad. Es por ello que espera aumentar su capital de trabajo para adquirir más animales y obtener mejores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Azapampa” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado, además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Felisa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus cerdos, además de más ejemplares.
texts.en:
Felisa, 34, is married to Jhony and they have three children from a previous relationship.  She’s now happy to have found a good man.  Jhony works in a mine and since it’s far away he comes home every three months.  

In the meantime, she works in her grocery store that she’s had for six months.  She knows that’s a short time but she’s not discouraged because she has good customers.  

But her main source of income is raising pigs that she buys in the city and then fattens up and cares for until they can be sold for a better price to butchers in her city’s largest market.  This is why she hopes to increase her working capital to buy more animals and obtain higher profits.

She belongs to the “Azapampa” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support provided and promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are responsible, supportive people.

Felisa will use the money requested to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pigs as well as more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 59 years old and married with six children.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Shirley has taken out and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years, and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Shirley aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Medrina

texts.en:
Medrina is 46 years old and married with three children.  With all of her children in school, Medrina works very hard to provide for them.

Medrina runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Medrina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Medrina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
