loans.use: to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate her rubber plant and cassava

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Esmeralda has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Esmeralda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar is 20 years old. He studies at Azerbaijan Technology University in the faculty of Standardizing and Technology Machines, years 2009-2013. He is single and lives with his parents who pay for his education fee. Their financial situation changed when Ilqar`s mother quit her job. Their financial situation in the family worsened and Ilqar applied for an 1,800 AZN loan to pay in advance his last two year`s education fees. It was a necessary step because in Azerbaijan, the tuition fees have to be paid in advance and it is not flexible.

loans.use: to pay his education fee

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es una madre de familia de  37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Pueblo Libre, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Tambogrande ubicado en la región Piura. La zona se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona es bastante pobre y sus servicios básicos son bastante precarios. 

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral como gallinas, pavos y patos. Ella los cría en su domicilio y cuando sus crías alcanzan el peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor con terreno agrícola propio en el cual tiene sembrado mango y pan llevar. 

Filomena desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen con éxito y puedan ser vendidos a mejores precios, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Filomena is a 37-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the village of Pueblo Libre. This rural area is part of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, which is located in the region of Piura and is situated more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo. In addition, this area is very poor and the basic services are scarce.

Filomena raises small animals, especially poultry such as hens, turkeys, and ducks. She raises the animals at home and when they reach the ideal size and weight, they are sold at the local market. Her husband is farmer who has his own land for growing mangoes and other food crops.

Filomena wants to acquire balanced feed in order for her animals to develop successfully so that they can be sold at better prices. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help accomplish this goal. She has already worked with Edpyme Alternativa on a previous occasion and demonstrated that she is a responsible client who is punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom is 58 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a palm juice and palm fruit vendor who earns about $3 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately $9 per day. In order to improve her farming work, Rom is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her farming expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Khayriddin

texts.ru: Хайриддин – 24 года, женился не давно, пока не имеет детей. Занимается торговлей мусульманских товаров и парфюмерии. Опыт в этой сфере деятельности более 3 лет. Хайриддин живет вместе с родителями. Его занятие является основным источником дохода для семьи. Он впервые кредитуется в нашей организации. На полученный кредит хочет расширить ассортимент товаров и увеличить свой товарооборот. Хайриддин выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khayriddin is 24 years old, soon getting married, and does not yet have children. He works with selling Islamic products and perfume. He has more than three years of experience in this area. 

Khayriddin lives together with his parents. His work is the main source of income for the family. This is the first time takes a loan from our organization. For the loan received he wants to expand the assortment of goods and increase the commodity turnover. Khayriddin expresses his gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of goods and increase turnover

loans.name: Urmat

texts.ru:
Урмат  43 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Урмат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйство Урмат насчитывает 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота и 1 корову. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урмат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Урмат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Urmat is 43 years old, is married and is the mother of 4 children.  Urmat has been raising livestock since 1998 as the main source of income for her family, having started this business with a sum of 12,000 somoni (KGS).  Today, Urmat's holdings include 15 heads of small livestock and one cow.  In order to further grow her business Urmat turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 somoni (KGS) to purchase additional livestock.  Urmat plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Goibnazar

texts.ru: Гоибназар проживает в города Истаравшан. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Гоибназар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этом ему помогает жена. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы, телят и бычков. Гоибназар более 18 лет занимается скотоводством.
texts.en: Goibnazar lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 54 years old.  He is married.  He has two children.  Goibnazar earns money by raising cattle.  His wife helps him.  He is taking out a loan to purchase cows, calves and young bulls.  Goibnazar has been raising livestock for more than 18 years.

loans.use: to purchase cows, calves and young bulls

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 38 years old. She currently resides at Gonzaga, where she sells frozen foods as a source of income. She is thankful because she has been earning PHP 2,000 every month, which she is saving for the educational purposes of her six children. To make her work more profitable, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase hotdogs. Hopefully, the loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hotdogs

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en:
Braulio is married and has three children. He is 38 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Braulio has been operating a gardening business for a living and his been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Recently, Braulio joined GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel. She is married and has two children.

Alma has a beauty salon business and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase nail polish, nail cutters, and other materials for giving manicures. Alma has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase nail polish, nail cutters, and other materials for giving manicures.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 31 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Emily has a fishing business. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Emily has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase gasoline, hooks, and nylon.

Emily has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Emily would like success in her business.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, hooks, and nylon.

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
As a parents of three, Channy and her husband have been growing cassava to support the family for four years. Channy is 29 years old and a villager in the Dambae District, where a common business is growing cassava. 

Channy obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2011. Having completely paid her previous two loans, Channy is now leading another female member of her group to apply for another loan. She plans to use her portion to spend on land plowing and labor. Channy hopes that this loan will help her to make more income so that she can feed her family better.

loans.use: To spend on land plowing and labor.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед, молодой мужчина – 28 лет, не женат, не имеет детей. Живет с родителями. Занимается торговлей дисков. Опыт в этой сфере деятельности более 3 лет. Его деятельность является основным доходом для семьи. На полученный кредит хочет расширить ассортимент товаров и увеличить свой товарооборот. Увеличив прибыль он хочет с каждого дохода откладывать деньги на свадьбу. Чамшед выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a young man of 28 years who is not married, and does not have children. He lives together with his parents. He works with selling music discs. He has more than three years of experience in this area. His work is the main income for the family. 

For the loan received Jamshed wants to expand the assortment of goods and increase his turnover. After increasing the profit he wants to save money from each income for marriage. Jamshed expresses his gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase music discs, expanding the assortment of goods

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам жительница района Яван. Она много лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Muharam is a resident of the Yavan region. She has worked with sowing crops for many years. She takes a loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bohodir

texts.ru: Боходир трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Пять лет назад приехал из России, который был на заработках, и начал занимается купле- продажей строительных материалов. Каждый день с 6:00 утра до 17:00 вечера усердно работает. Имеет много постоянных клиентов. Боходир хотел бы получить займ для покупки досок разных размеров для продажи с целью расширения бизнеса
texts.en:
Bohodir is a hard working and honest man who is married and raising two children. Five years ago he came from Russia, where he was a migrant worker, and started working with buying and selling building materials. Every day from 6 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon he works diligently. He has many regular customers. 

Bohodir would like to receive a loan for the purchase of boards of various sized for selling, with an aim to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase boards of various sizes for selling

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 50 años muy activa que le gusta trabajar. Cuando la conocimos nos recibió con una gran sonrisa y con la misma sonrisa termino su entrevista. Su personalidad demuestra mucha vitalidad y energía la que necesita para su día a día. Vive en Quevedo dedicándose a la venta de artículos de bazar. Este negocio lo empezó por que es muy comercial y de fácil venta por el costo y por lo llamativo. Sus productos van desde ropa interior, moños, diademas, artículos de fomix para la decoración, muñecas de trapo etc. Ana recorre la ciudad con sus productos en una maleta en compañía de su sobrina. Ella estudia en el colegio pero necesita el dinero por eso la acompaña a diario desde las 8 de la mañana. Le gusta lo que hace porque le ha ayudado a salir adelante u cumplir poco a poco sus metas. Ana nos comenta que su mayor preocupación son los ladrones ya que como son mujeres y llevan dinero son propensas a sufrir asaltos. De su vida personal nos comenta que estuvo casada pero su esposo la abandono con sus hijos. En la actualidad ya son mayores tienen 37, 32 y 28 años todos son casados y de vez en cuando se visitan. Quiere mucho a su familia porque ellos le dieron la fortaleza de salir adelante. Con el préstamo piensa adquirir mercadería para aumentar sus ventas espera en un futuro cercano poder estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 50, is a very active woman who likes to work.  When we met her she received us with a big smile and finished the interview still smiling.  Her personality exhibits much vitality and energy needed for her day to day.  She lives in Quevedo and sells general merchandise.  

She started the business because it’s very commercial and easy to sell because of its cost and because it’s eye-catching.  Her products range from underwear, ribbons, hair bands, Foamy decorative items, rag dolls, etc.  Ana goes from place to place in the city carrying her items in a suitcase accompanied by her niece who attends high school but needs money which is why she accompanies her every day from 8am. 

She likes what she does because it’s helped her get ahead and gradually reach her goals.  Ana tells us that her greatest concern is thieves because since they are women and they are carrying money they are vulnerable to being robbed.

With respect to her personal life, she comments that she was married but her husband abandoned her with her children.  They are currently adults who are 37, 32 and 27 years of age, all married; they visit her from time to time.  She loves her family very much because they gave her the strength to carry on.  She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise to increase her sales hoping in the near future to be able to stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Telesforo

texts.es: Carlos vive en Libertad y a sus 53 años de edad tiene una tienda ubicada en su domicilio. Vive junto a su esposa Isabel quien se dedica a la costura para personar particulares. Sus hijos son mayores de edad y solo uno vive con ellos y se encuentra cursando la escuela fiscal. Comenzó abriendo una pequeña tienda en su sector ya que no había en su momento ninguna. Hace 6 años que la abrió y le ha ido muy bien tanto así que ahora la a podido ampliar. El negocio lo realiza junto a su esposa quien dice acompañarlo para que no se aburra. Su jornada de trabajo no es cansada ya que abren a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche todos los días. Carlos nos comenta que lo mejor es poder tener control de su tiempo y por eso el día que se encuentra cansado no abre sin tener mayores problemas. Hace poco también empezaron la venta de comida en las noches y les está dando buenos resultados. Con el préstamo comprara productos para la tienda. Calos nos dice que su meta es poner un taller de reparación de bicicletas y otros dos negocios más. Sin duda nuestra pareja tiene mucho por delante…suerte.
texts.en:
Carlos, 53, lives in Libertad; he has a home-based grocery store.  He lives with his wife, Isabel, who sews for individuals.  His children are adults and only one still lives with them; he attends public school.

He started out opening a small store in his neighborhood because there weren’t any at that time.  He opened it six years ago and he’s done very well, so much so that he’s now been able to enlarge it.  He works alongside his wife who says she keeps him company so that he won’t get bored.  His work day isn’t too demanding since they are open from 8 in the morning to 7 at night every day.

Carlos comments that the best part is being able to control his own time so in days when he’s tired he doesn’t open and this is no problem.  A short while ago they also started selling food at night and it’s having good results.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the store.  Carlos tells us that his goal is to open a bicycle repair shop and two other businesses.  We [Banco D-MIRO S.A.] believe that our couple has much ahead of them….Good Luck.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: Desde la Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil les contamos la historia de Rosa. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 15 años que estudian el colegio. Su incursión en el comercio empezó cuando termino sus estudios universitarios. Junto a su esposo decidieron comenzar con una pequeña farmacia. Ahora el ya no se encuentra con ellos pero está segura de que estaría satisfecho con sus logros. La atención la realiza sola desde las 8 de mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Las mayores dificultades en su negocio es la competencia del sector ya que hay varias farmacias cercanas y la delincuencia que es muy frecuente en su barrio. Con el crédito comprara fármacos para aumentar su inventario esperando vender más. Su sueño y meta es abrir otro local y terminar de arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa's story comes from Isla Trinitaria in Guayaquil. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has two children (ages 16 and 15) who are in high school. Rosa started her business after she finished her university studies. Together with her husband, she decided to open a small pharmacy. Even though he is no longer around, Rosa is confident that he would have been satisfied with their achievements. She works alone from 8am to 7pm. Her greatest difficulties in her business are dealing with the competition in the area since there are several other pharmacies located nearby, and coping with the frequent crime in her neighborhood.

With this loan, Rosa will buy medicines to increase her inventory in hopes of selling more. Her dream and goal is to open another location and finish the repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 45 years old and married with three children: one daughter and two sons. Her younger son does not work, while her first two children help their father in his business selling rolls of thread. Her husband has been involved in this profession for the last 15 years. He has full support from his family. Parveen's daughter helps her father arrange his thread and her son helps him sell them in different markets.

Parveen herself is involved in a sewing business. Her work is home-based. She collects orders from her neighboring customers and earns income after completing the orders on time.

Parveen has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying threads in larger quantities for reselling.  Parveen hopes that with this investment, his business will continue to prosper so that he can offer an even better service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy rolls of thread to sell.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 59 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two children.

Jerson is engaged in a fishing and fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing additional fishing nets.

Jerson has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a woman who operates a charcoal selling business and she has been doing so for the past three years. She operates this business from her home, selling to the community and travelers. Seasonality is her major challenge and she aspires to open a charcoal depot in the future so as to increase her sales. Caroline lives in her own house that does not have piped water. She decided to join Yehu in order to get access to loans. The loan of KES 30,000 will help her purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 34-year-old married man with three children ages 5, 7, and 9. He has been fishing to support his family for eight years. He works hard to increase his profits and provide for his family's basic necessities. He requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps, and gasoline. Michael is hoping for his business to be more productive. He also hopes to have sufficient income to pay for his children's school enrollment fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps, and gasoline.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 54 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children.

Lilibeth has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to use to purchase feed for her other business, which is hog raising.

Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru: Майсара продолжает свою деятельность. Она вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для земледелия, внедрения минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Maysara is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 37 years old and married. She has eight children. Maysara and her husband work with growing vegetables. They have been working with this type of activity for six years. 

They take a loan to introduce mineral fertilizers in their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 63 years old. She lives in a small village with her family, including her husband Givi, her four children, and her daughter-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business; They have two cows and four calves. Tina and Givi keep their livestock in good condition and take good care of them. Tina is also busy with farming. She has 0.8 hectare of land where she grows 1000 vine trees. She sells harvested product on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari. 
Tina requested a loan to purchase calves. She wants to grow them and sell them after a few months with a price mark up. Also, she will be able to produce and sell more dairy food. She wants to expand her business in order to make her desired profit. With the increased amount of profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business, as well as spend more on her family's daily needs. Due to the above-mentioned, the family’s living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Molmol

texts.ru:
Молмол 44 года, замужем. Молмол в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 17 лет назад начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Молмол имеется  1 корова с приплодом, 1 кобыла, 10 овец и 2,72 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Молмол обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян фасоли.  Доходы от кредита Молмол планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Molmol is 44 years old and married. As a main source of income for her family, Molmol started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding 17 years ago, having started this business with an amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Currently Molmol's farm has one cow with offspring, one mare, 10 sheep and 2.72 hectares of land, where she grows beans and potatoes. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Molmol turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and bean seeds. Molmol plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and bean seeds

loans.name: Oydinoy

texts.ru: Ойдиной жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. В основном Ойдиной разводит мелко - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа коз.
texts.en:
Oydinoy is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. She is 45 years old and married. She has three children. 

Together with her husband, she works with livestock breeding. Oydinoy mainly breeds sheep and goats. She has been engaged in this type of activity for five years. She takes a loan for the purchase of goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жипар 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Жипар в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2001 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 26,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня хозяйство Жипар приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц c продажи молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жипар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жипар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Jipar is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children. As a main source of income for her family, Jipar has been working with livestock breeding since 2001, having started this business with an amount of 26,000 som (KGS). Today, Jipar's farm brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Jipar turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. Jipar plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Belsita Lida

texts.es: Belsita empezó hace 6 años vendiendo comidas rápidas, varios meses después salió embarazada por lo que decidió vender embutidos, pollo y carne aprovechando que ya tenía clientes. El negocio lo mantiene en su domicilio ya que de esa manera puede cuidar a sus hijos. No tiene ningún horario establecido porque siempre pasa en casa. Su mayor problema de momento es que su domicilio no está muy bien ubicado lo que lo hace poco visible para los clientes. Con la delincuencia no ha tenido mayores problemas aunque vive en el Suburbio y tiene mala proyección. Belsita está casada con Alex quien es albañil y juntos mantienen el hogar. Tiene 2 hijos de un año y de 13 años que está asistiendo a la escuela fiscal. El préstamo lo va a emplear para la compra de productos para la venta. Belsita nos despide agradeciendo a Dios por haber salido adelante junto a su familia y a D-Miro por su gestión en la ayuda que brinda.
texts.en:
Belsita began selling fast food six years ago. Several months later she got pregnant, so she decided to sell cold cuts, chicken and meat, taking advantage of the fact that she already had customers. She runs the store out of her home, as that way she can look after her children.

She does not have fixed hours because she is always home. Her biggest problem at the moment is that her home is not very well located, which makes it not very visible for customers. She has not great problems with crime even though she lives in the Suburbio area and lacks a visible location. 

Belsita is married to Alex, who is a construction worker, and together they support the household. She has two children, a one year old, and a 13 year old who is going to public school. She is going to use the loan to purchase products to sell. Belsita says goodbye to us, thanking God for her having moved forward with her family, and to D-Miro for its management of the assistance that it offers.

loans.use: To buy meat, chicken and cold cuts.

loans.name: Katwebumbe Youth Group

texts.en:
Katwebumbe, which translates as "Let’s mold ourselves,” was started by young women and men who were involved in the molding of stoves and ventilators out of clay. But they were and still are challenged by limited capital and rains that delay the drying process.

The men and women wanted to improve their and their families’ lives, but it was difficult for each to save enough money to do something big like build a house. So they decided as a group to borrow a lump sum and repay it in installments. In this case Katwebumbe has borrowed 2900 UGX from UGAFODE.

Sarah, a single mother of three, has taken her share to complete her house and is using the balance to buy firewood to dry the stoves. With the income from her stoves, she has been able not only to finish her house but to continue educating her children as well.

The group’s dream is to buy a cement mixer to mix the clay because doing it manually is time-consuming and hectic.

loans.use: To buy firewood and complete building her house.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 35-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business selling Samoan cocoa, and vegetables like cabbage, in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Patricia has requested a loan of WST2000 to pay her children's school fees. She will also use part of her loan to buy vegetable seeds for her garden. She plans to use her profits to improve her home. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Maafaavae

texts.en:
Maafaavae is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Maafaavae needs a loan to buy more gardening equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

 Maafaavae will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shovels, chemicals, and gloves

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 33 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo,Lopez Jaena . He is married with one child. 
To earn a living, Oliver has a business of Hypo chloride selling. He earns about PHP 6,500 each month doing this type of work. Oliver has requested a loan of 20000 to purchase for gallons of hypo chloride to sell.
Oliver has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Oliver hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase gallons of hypo chloride to sell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is 27. She lives in Bnunis village with her husband and two little sons. The couple is involved in agriculture. Sona would like to increase the number of cattle she has and prepare the land for cultivation, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the requested loan, Sona plans to purchase 20 sheep and 700kg of potato seeds. Sona plans to raise the sheep and sell them next year. This will provide additional income for her, which is important for this young family to cover daily costs and make savings for the future development of agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sheep and 700kg of potato seeds.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 52 years old, married, and has three children. He and his wife work hard to provide for their children’s needs. In fact, Alfredo is willing to work hard every single day to give his family a good quality of life.

While his wife has raised hogs in their village, Alfredo has devoted himself to farming corn for the past twenty years. He is now requesting a 37,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy seed, pesticides and fertilizer for his crops. He hopes to harvest more corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy seed, pesticides and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 44 years old, married and has two children. The family lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta in Misamis Occidental Province.

To earn a living, Mercy has a sari-sari, or general store, where she sells a variety of products. She has been in business for six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

For the past six years Mercy has been a member of PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP from them to buy more stock for her store. Mercy’s ambition is to see all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Giovany

texts.es:
Giovanni actualmente cuenta con 24 años de edad y continúa viviendo junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Vallecito, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. 

Desde hace algunos meses ha empezado a trabajar en el negocio de crianza y venta de ganado ovino, contando con unas 25 ovejas, las cuales cría en un corral cercano a su vivienda. Adicionalmente sigue trabajando junto a su marido en su plantación de limón, cuyos frutos extrae para comercializarlos con los acopiadores locales.

Actualmente Giovany desea adquirir una pequeña extensión de correo de media hectárea en la cual piensa plantar también limón para poder incrementar sus ingresos mensuales. Para lograr sus objetivos ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3500 nuevos soles. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito Kiva anteriormente, el cual ha pagado con puntualidad, asimismo se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron en aquella oportunidad
texts.en:
Giovany is currently 24 years old and continues to live with her husband and young son in the village of Vallecito, a rural area in the farming district of Tambogrande, which is located in the region of Piura.

Giovany began raising and selling sheep a few months ago. She now has about 25 heads of sheep, which she keeps in a pen near her home. In addition, she continues to work with her husband on his lime plantation. The fruits are harvested in order to be sold to the local collection centers.

At the moment, Giovany wants to acquire a small extension of land that measures a half hectare. She wants to plant more lime trees so that she can increase her monthly income. In order to accomplish her goals, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,500 PEN. She already had a previous Kiva loan that was repaid on time. Giovany is very grateful to everyone who helped her on that occasion.

loans.use: to acquire an extension of land for growing limes.

loans.name: Irma Victoria

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 68 años, muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, vive en la ciudad de Pisco; con mucho esfuerzo y empeño Irma logró salir adelante y superar las adversidades luego de separarse de su esposo, ella tiene un hijo de 28 años con quien en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y  en ocasiones comer juntos su comida favorita “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”; Irma concluyo sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiese gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas. 
Gracias a los buenos consejos y enseñanzas de su padre, Irma emprendió su negocio de venta de postres con mucho empeño y entusiasmo,  ella lleva 2 años realizando este negocio, al cual le dedica aproximadamente 6 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente.  
Irma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mostradores y vitrinas para acondicionar su negocio; asimismo, podrá utilizar parte del dinero como capital de trabajo para incrementar sus ventas; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y en un futuro no muy lejano sueña poder tener un puesto de venta de postres en el mercado de su ciudad, mejorando de esta manera su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma, 68, is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family and lives in the city of Pisco.  Irma managed to get ahead and overcome adversity with a lot of effort and dedication when she separated from her husband.  She has a 28-year-old son with whom she likes to play sports in her spare time.  Sometimes they eat together; her favorite dish is "carapulcra con sopa seca" [pork with noodles].  Irma finished her secondary studies but she very much would like to have been able to study systems engineering.

Irma launched her dessert business with great effort and enthusiasm, thanks to her father's good advice and instruction.  She has been doing this business for two years; she dedicates approximately six hours a day to it and can serve up to 30 customers.

Irma is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy counters and display cases to equip her business.  In addition, she will use part of the money as working capital to increase her sales.  This way she will be able to improve her income.

She dreams of being able to have a dessert store in the market of her city in the near future to increase her sales, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy counters and display cases to equip her dessert business.

loans.name: Ivan Augusto

texts.es: Iván vive en Libertad tiene 21 años y tiene un local de venta de electrodomésticos. En estos momentos se encuentra estudiando la universidad al tiempo que atiende su negocio. Iván nos cuenta que la idea de emprender su propio negocio se dio porque como estudia no podía tener un trabajo por los horarios, también necesita dinero para pagar los estudios. Por ayuda de sus padres alquilo un local y empezó la venta. el negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingos sin horario establecido. De momento se encuentra soltero y no tiene hijos pero en un futuro le gustaría tener su familia. Con el préstamo piensa ingresar a la venta de ropa comprando blusas, camisas y pantalones. A futuro le gustaría aumentar su negocio con el fin de tener más ingresos y poder abrir en un local de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Iván is 21 years old and lives in Libertad. He has a shop where he sells household appliances. At the moment, he is studying at the university while managing his business. Iván says that he came up with the idea to start his own business because he could not maintain a regular work schedule while in school, but he still needed money to pay for his studies. With the help of his parents, he rented a shop and started his business. Iván manages his business Monday through Sunday without a set schedule. He is single and has no children at the moment, but he would like to have a family in the future.

With this loan, Iván plans to add the sale of clothing by purchasing blouses, shirts, and trousers. He would like to expand his business in the future so that he can generate more income and be able to have a storefront of his own.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a farmer who lives in Sta. Rosa with his spouse and four children who attend school. He would like to give the best education to them, but it requires additional capital to improve their living standards. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They usually earn about PHP 10,000 each harvest season, twice a year. He is now borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

Someday, with good profits from the business, he hopes to earn funds to invest in buying another plot of land to diversify his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador, who is 60 years old, is married to a housewife and blessed with six children. The family harmoniously lives in Disimuray. Dominador has been growing corn for almost 20 years. He earned 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from the last harvest. 

Dominador is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers for his farm. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Sroeun's Group

texts.en: Sroeun is 60 years old and a mother of seven, two of whom are staying with the family and helping at the farm. To earn a living, Sroeun and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for around 15 years. They also raise pigs to make additional income. Sroeun has been with VisionFund for three loans and now is leading a group of two members to apply for another loan after her third loan has been paid. As a leader, Sroeun will use her portion to spend on land preparation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and hence sell the products for higher prices so that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting

loans.name: Génesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo génesis lo conforman cinco personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana del Rosario quien desde hace 18 años se dedica al comercio de corte de ropa; además hace 5 años inicio a vender comida. El crédito lo invertirá en ambos negocios con la compra de  mercadería (telas, granos básicos, carne, perecederos).
Juana tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo depende de ella el menor de 16 años quien está cursando la secundaria. 
Los otros integrantes son Rosa de 39 años quien vende ropa, Mirta de 35 años se dedica al comercio de ropa, Juan de 31 años vende telas desde hace 5 años, José Armando de 49 años quien es comerciante de ropa y corte de ropa desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The group "Genesis" is made up of 5 hardworking and enterprising people.  One of these is Juana del Rosarios, who for 18 years has had a business selling cut fabric. She also has 5 years of experience selling food.  She will invest this loan in both of her businesses, with the purchase of merchandise (fabric, staple grains, meat and perishable grocery items).

Juana has 6 children, of whom only 1 still depends on her.  That child is 16, and is attending high school.

The other members of this group are Rosa, 39, who sells clothing, Mirta, 35, who also sells clothing, Juan, 31 who has been selling fabric for 5 years, and Jose Armando, 49, who has been selling clothing and cut fabric for 15 years.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 42 years old and has been engaged in the pig business for the last five years. She usually buys piglets, fattens and then sells them for a profitable price. Her monthly income from the business is saved for the education of her children. She is now requesting additional funds to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig business. The loan of PHP 12,000 will be beneficial to her business and her family. She just hopes that it will continues improve in order to make their living conditions better.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig business.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is a hardworking mother. Aside from being a good mother, she also helped her spouse maintain the farming business. She is applying for this loan because she wants to improve their crop production from the hectare plot of land they cultivates. The couple have planted and harvested rice for almost five years and earn about PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year). From her loan of PHP 15,000, she will buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides use in farming. She promises to pay back her loan in full and continue growing as a successful rice grower.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a forty-year-old woman with four children between the ages of seven and twenty, both of whom are in school. She has been operating a tailoring business for the last eight years. In addition, she operates a vegetable stall selling to her neighbors. Beatrice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes the high price of commodities to be her major challenge, and says that her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children. 

She plans to use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase clothing materials and sacks of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is married with three children. Genevieve is 31 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City.

To earn a living, Genevieve has a hog-fattening business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase feed and piglets. Genevieve has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Genevieve hopes to own a piggery.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Junie

texts.en: Junie is from the village of Disimuray. He is 46 years old and is married. Junie has been engaged in corn production for almost 20 years. He earned approximately 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from his last crop. He has worked hard to provide for their needs and to have a good quality of life. Now, he is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production

loans.name: Maria Genie

texts.en: Maria Genie is 41 years old, married and has three children attending school. She is raising hogs to sell as her source of income while her spouse is a farmer. Maria Genie has insufficient funds to meet the needs of her hogs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine for her hogs. Hopefully, after four to five months she will offer her hogs at higher prices for additional profits.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamin and medicine.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is married with three children. Nelyn is 54 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Nelyn sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Nelyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Nelyn hopes to have more time and savings.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente est  trésorière du groupe Baraka Alanine, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est vendeur de bassin plastic au marché sectoriel de Kibabi-Birere. Elle commença ses activités vers les années 2002, tout juste après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, alors avec son fond propre.  Et cela,  par la vente des  divers objets ménagers notamment des assiettes, casseroles, fourchettes, etc. plus tard, elle bénéficia  un fond additionnel de crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima en 2006 pour renforcer son business de commerce. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché communal de Katindo-Alanine. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  d’autres marchandises. Elle souhaiterait  construire honorablement sa maison et faire scolariser ses enfants. En plus, elle ambitionne ouvrir un magasin de taille dans la ville. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client is the treasurer of the Baraka Alanine group. She is 37-years old, married, and mother of two children who both attend school.  Her husband is a seller of plastic basins at the Kibabi-Birere market.  She started her business with her own money around 2002, just after the Nyiragongo volcano eruption.  She sells various household objects, such as plates, pots, forks, etc.  She later received additional funding via a loan from IMF Hekima in 2006  to strengthen her business.  She displays her merchandise at the Katindo-Alanine communal market.  This new loan will enable her to stock up on other merchandise.  She would like to construct her own home and send her children to school.  In addition, she aims to open a sizable store in the city.  She thanks Hekima for their efforts to serve poor women underserved by traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy two dozen plates.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Wilmer Gerardo

texts.es:
Wilmer es un joven de 20 años, muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la calurosa ciudad de chincha, conocida también por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del peruano y también porque sus pobladores tiene un don en la preparación de platillos ya que cocinan de manera riquísima. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Wilmer le gusta mucho salir a jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo aprovecha en algunas oportunidades disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Wilmer trabaja en una empresa de venta de productos eléctricos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha paciencia cuando de atenderlos se trata.

Wilmer está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de un baño y cercado de su vivienda, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia principalmente sus padres ya que actualmente su vivienda solo tiene letrinas, así como también dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda, así el podrá seguir mejorando cada día y poder luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 20 years old, very hard-working and enthusiastic, and lives in the hot city of Chincha, known for being the cradle of great Peruvian glories and for its inhabitants making tasty meals. During his free time Wilmer likes to play soccer with his friend and neighbors. He also likes to indulge in one of his favorite dishes which is “rice with duck.” Due to his parents lack of funds he was only able to get into high school but he said he would've liked to go to a university.

Wilmer works enthusiastically with an electronics company. He works around 10 hours a day and his job is going very well since he is very friendly with the clients and above all very patient when attending them.

Wilmer is very thankful for the kiva lenders because through their help he will be able to build a bathroom and fence around his home to offer his family a better home. As of now they only have a latrine and a fence will provide more safety. Every day he will work hard to make his biggest dream a reality: “owning his own home.”

loans.use: to build a bathroom and fence around his home

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
Maria tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra ubicada en la selva de nuestro país y la cual alberga flora y fauna maravillosa y tiene unos paisajes maravillosos en los cuales se puede apreciar la grandeza de la naturaleza. Maria es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales ya están casados y le han dado unos maravillosos nietos a los cuales  adora al igual que su esposo, cuando Maria tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con sus nietos, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Sopa de Pollo. Ella solo estudio hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Maria trabaja día a día en su negocio de venta de comida, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 80 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como cemento para colocar piso en su negocio, asimismo comprara calaminas para arreglar el techo de su negocio ya que actualmente está muy dañado, así de esta manera ella podrá brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y mayor comodidad, para así seguir luchando cada día y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un restaurante mas grande”.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old, lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the jungle of our country which is home to beautiful flowers, fauna, and scenery were nature’s greatness can be appreciated. Maria is a mother of two of which are married and have given her wonderful grandchildren she adores as much as her husband. During her free time Maria likes to take her grandchildren out and indulge in one of her favorite meals which is chicken soup. She only studied up to the fourth year of high schooI but would've liked to go on to study at a university.

Maria works enthusiastically every day for a living. She works around 10 hours daily and can attend up to 80 clients in one day. She believes her business is going well because she is friendly to the clients and above all she cooks very well.

Maria is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because through them she will be able to buy materials needed to install a new floor in her restaurant as well as buy iron to fix her roof which is damaged. This will allow her to offer her clients better service and comfort. She will work hard everyday to make her biggest dream a reality: “Have a bigger restaurant.”

loans.use: buy cement and iron

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado,  vive con sus dos hijos y el esposa  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café y los insumos correspondientes  como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado comprar el almacigo para su posterior siembra en un terreno de la familia y con los  insumos poder darle el mantenimiento adecuado  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Maritza is 50 years old, married, and lives with her children and husband. She will use the loan to buy coffee seeds and corresponding materials such as fertilizer, fumigation, and labor. She plans on buying the seeds to sew for this season on the family’s land and use her materials to maintain the crop to increase profits and gain a better quality life and financial stability. This will be her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has never had a loan in a state bank but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with more ease and much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and corresponding materials such as fertilizer, fumigation, and labor

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jose Evelio

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y su compañera se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, con la cual procreó  2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad y vive en la Ciudad de Villanueva, Cortes.
Don José tiene un negocio de un taller de Ebanistería, lo estableció hace 6 años con la idea de superarse y generar sus propios ingresos. El servicio que ofrece son acabados de madera como mesas, divisiones, puertas y closet. Esta satisfecho porque los ingresos que le genera  este negocio es rentable y sabido administrarlo muy bien. Trabaja todo el día haciendo los muebles para la venta.  
En ODEF solicito su primer préstamo de 6,000 lempiras, que le ayudara para comprar madera para seguir haciendo sus productos y seguir generando ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su plan en el futuro es trabajar mucho para que su taller sea más grande y así poder contratar personal  para la fabricación de los muebles.
texts.en:
José is 38 years and in a common-law relationship with his companion who is a devoted homemaker. They have two children, ages 6 and 2, and live in city of Villanueva, Cortes.

Don José has a furniture-making business and workshop. He came up with this idea six years ago because wanted to succeed and generate his own income. The service he offers includes making finished wooden pieces such as tables, room dividers, doors, and closets. He is satisfied because the revenues that his business generates are profitable and managed very well. José works every day at making furniture to sell.

He is requesting his first loan from ODEF in the amount of 6,000 HNL, which will help him to buy wood for making his products. This will continue generating the income he needs to sustain his family. His plans for the future are to work hard so that he can have a larger shop and to hire employees for making the furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile, pictured next to his taxi.

Doaa, 24, is married to Mohammad and the mother of three sons. Her husband is employed, but the salary he gets isn't enough to cover the family's needs. So, for the past four years, he has also been a taxi driver. He takes internal and external requests for his services. It has been a successful business, but Mohammad needs more support to cover costs.

To improve her family's living conditions and to help her husband improve the family's income, Doaa is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN. The loan would enable her husband to make some necessary repairs to the taxi, such as painting, changing the motor and the tires. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Doaa's husband to work extra hours in order to improve the family's income and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to repair the taxi and replace the motor.

loans.name: Bon's Group

texts.en: Bon, 42, is a widowed mother of two who are still in school. To feed the family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for nearly 20 years. A main challenge for her is when the price of cassava drops. Bon and her current group members have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and now they are applying for the third loan. As a leader, Bon is planning to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy and cassava plantation. She really hopes this loan will help to increase her crop yield so that she can sell the products when the price is high and therefore have sufficient money to support the family and set aside some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz tiene 57 años de edad, pero se considera una joven de 20 en espíritu, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero a quienes ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y tuvo que convertirse en padre y madre para ellos, pero gracias a ello sus hijos la miran con mucho orgullo y la quieren mucho ya que fue muy valiente. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón. Cuando Luz tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial sus novelas, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres, ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Luz trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 4 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad  a precios cómodos.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como Chompas, casacas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; así de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer más productos para sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una buena calidad de vida y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old, but considers having a 20 year old’s spirit. She is a mother of 3 who are grown up. She took it upon herself to raise her children since her husband abandoned them when they were young. She had to take the roll of mother and father and now her children admire her for her efforts and love her for being so brave. She lives in the district of Parcona which is characterized as having a warm and hot climate. It is also known for its agriculture specifically cotton cultivation. During her free time Luz likes to watch television, especially soap operas, and indulges in her favorite dish which is “Rice with Chicken.” Since her parents lacked the funds she only studied until high school but would have liked to attend a university.

Luz works enthusiastically every day selling clothes for a living. She works around 4 hours a day and can attend up to 6 clients in one day. She believes her business is going well because she is friendly to the clients and offers quality products and reasonable prices.

Luz is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because through them she will be able to buy merchandise such as sweaters, jackets, pants, shirts, among others. This will allow her to offer her clients more variety and increase profits. She will work hard everyday to make her biggest dream a reality: “Have a good quality of life and grow her business.”

loans.use: buy merchandise such as sweaters, jackets,  pants, shirts, among others

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que les brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los que viven con ella tienen 18 y 13 años de edad y estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual es artesano y tiene un taller en su casa donde realiza una gran variedad de figuras hechas en resina y cerámica, nos cuenta que el elabora llaveros, escapularios, pendientes, entre otras muchas figuras, él realiza estos trabajos a base de pedidos que le hacen comerciantes que luego los llevan  a otras ciudades donde son muy apreciados sus trabajos. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo lleva más de 17 años con este negocio y que le va muy bien.

Nuestra amiga está repitiendo el crédito el mismo que como siempre es para comprar resinas colombianas y estuches para el negocio del esposo, nos cuenta que le fue más o menos en esta temporada que paso lo malo fue que su computadora se les daño pero que gracias a las ganancias y los créditos pudieron comprar otra y seguir en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es  arreglar una parte de la casa que aún le falta por terminar.
texts.en:
The Community Bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the region of Montecristi and the village of Manabita, a community that is full or hardworking people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots and heritage. Sequita is a parish with honest citizens who work hard and are dedicated to their families.

Carmen is a founding member of the Community Bank, and likes being a part of the bank because of the benefits the members receive. She is 43 years old, and is married. She had four children, but two of them passed away, and her living children are now 18 and 13 years old and are in high school. Her husband is an artisan craftsman.

She is requesting this loan for her husband, who is an artisan craftsman and who has a workshop in his home where he makes a wide variety of ceramic and resin figurines. He also makes key chains, scapulars, pendants, and many other figures. He makes items in response to customer orders, and because customers then transport the items to other cities, his work is widely known. Carmen explains that her husband has worked in this business for more than 17 years, and that he is doing very well in his trade.

Carmen is requesting another loan for the same purposes, to purchase Colombian resin and cases for her husband’s business. In the past year their computer broke, but thanks to her previous loan they were able to buy another one and continue their business.
 
Her dream is to finish building a part of their house which is still unfinished.

loans.use: to buy Colombian resin and cases.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Del Ejido Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Golondrinas” está conformado por ocho mujeres que se dedican al campo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables el nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas comentan que el nombre de Golondrinas se les ocurrió por los pajaritos quien hay en su comunidad y ejido por el lugar donde viven.
Doña María del Socorro pero como la llaman Mari de cariño y quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 37 años  de edad está casada con el señor benjamín desde hace 13 años juntos han formado una familia con 3 niños dos de ellos van a la escuela
Mary se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace dos años la actividad la inicio ya que la idea se la dio su cuñada por el momento tiene dos borregos que cuida mucho ya que todas las mañana se levanta a darles de comer pastura, zacate o maíz molido lo que tenga cuando ve que ya  están muy sucios los limpia, también les ofrece agua cuando es muy necesario.
Esta vez esta solicitando el crédito para comparar mas borregos si le alcanza comprara dos y su alimento necesario lo que más le gusta  a Mari es cuando sus borregas le dan borreguitos bebes ya que tiene una borreguita que apenas dio una cría y Mary la recibió con mucho gusto y emoción mientras Mari nos contaba sus experiencia con los borreguitos en manera de chascarrillo dijo “Y lo que menos me gusta es que lloran mucho y no sé porque quizás porque está muy consentida y sabe que se le dará todo lo que pide” también nos cuenta que su dificultad es cuando sus borregos enferman y mueren y casi todas las integrantes del grupo coinciden  también otra dificultad de Mary es que el lugar donde tiene sus borregas es un espacio muy pequeño.
La meta de Mary es que sus hijos terminen una carrera aunque sea corta pero que tengan un trabajo seguro ya que quiere que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore.
Las integrantes de grupo son Elena invertirá en cerdos y pollos, Lura comprara pastura para borregos,  Carmen para comprar cerdos, Candelaria comprara pollos y cerdos, Maribel comprara pollos, Victorina comprara Cerdos y Guajolotes y finalmente Cristina comprara borregos ellas son integrantes del grupo Las Golondrinas del Ejido están sinceramente agradecidas con el crédito otorgado que FRAC y KIVA les dan.
texts.en:
The group “Las Golondrinas”  is made up of 8 hardworking and responsible women who work in the fields.  They say that they chose this name (The Swallows) because these small birds are found in the community and ejido (communal farming lands) where they live.  Maria del Socorro (who is affectionately called Mari) is the representative of this group.  She tells us that she is 37 years old and has been married to Benjamin for 13 years.  They have formed a family with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. 

Mari has had a business raising sheep for 2 years.  She started this business because of an idea given to her by her sister-in-law.  She currently has 2 sheep that she cares for very well.  Every morning she gets up and gives them hay, pasture grass or ground corn.  When she sees that they are very dirty she washes them, and she also provides them with water when needed.  

This time she is requesting a loan to buy more sheep.  She would like to buy two, and the food to feed them.  What Mari enjoys the most about this work is when her sheep have babies, because she has a sheep that just had a baby and Mari received it with a lot of excitement and pleasure.  Meanwhile, Mari told us about her experience with the baby sheep in a joking manner, saying, "What I like the least is when they cry a lot and I don't know why.  Perhaps it's because they are very spoiled and so they know that I will give them anything they ask for."  She also tells us that it she finds it difficult when her sheep get sick and die, and almost all of the group members agree.  Also, another difficulty that Mari faces is that the place where she has her sheep is a very small space.  Mari's goal is to have her children finish a course of study, even a short one, so that they can have a secure job, because she wants her family's quality of life to improve.  

The members of this group are: Elena, who will invest in pigs and chickens, Lura, who will buy pasture grass for sheep, Carmen, who will buy pigs, Candelaria, who will buy chickens and pigs, Maribel, who will buy chickens, Victorina, who will buy pigs and turkeys, and finally, Cristina, who will buy sheep.  The members of the group "Las Golondrinas del Ejido," are sincerely grateful for this loan that is being granted to them by FRAC and by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pasture grass

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Martha Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 14, 9, 7, 4  y 1 año, la mayor estudia en colegio y vive con los abuelos ya que es de otro compromiso que tuvo, los dos siguientes estudian en la escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual  vende empanadas, alas de pollo asadas, corviches, aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella en la mañana prepara algunos de sus productos para  vender en la tarde,  ella además también cría pollos y chanchos ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente en su casa para aquello, esta también es una pequeña pero fuente de ingresos que tiene para salir adelante. Lleva más de 3 años en esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Nuestra amiga está repitiendo y nos cuenta que a pesar de que la temporada no fue del todo buena igual le quedo ganancias las mismas que utilizo para gastos relacionados con los estudios de sus hijos, ahora espera realizar otro crédito el mismo que va a utilizar para comprar pollos y alimento para estos ya que esta temporada es muy buena con la venta de sus animalitos. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su vida.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Maria Auxiliadora" meets in the Sequita parish, which is a part of Montecristo, in the rural community of Manabita. This community is full of hard working, dedicated people who are proud of where they come from. The people of Sequita are honest and know how to work hard and dedicate themselves to their families. 

Martha is from this community. She is 37 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has five children: 14, 9, 7,4 and 1 years old. The oldest child is studying in an institute and lives with her grandparents, which is another commitment she has made. The second and third oldest children are also studying. Her husband is a businessman.  

Our friend has a small business in her house, from which she sells empanadas (a filled pastry), corviches (sweet plantain dough stuffed with spicy seafood and then baked or fried), grilled chicken wings, sodas, juices and other things. She told us that in the mornings she prepares some of her products which she sells in the afternoons. She also raises chickens and pigs, because she has room to do so near her house. This also is a small source of income which helps her to get ahead. She has been doing this for the past three years and she is doing very well.   

Our friend told us that even though the season was not completely good, she was still left with profits, which she used to pay expenses related to the her children's education. Now she would like to take out another loan to use to buy chickens and food for the chickens. Right now is a high season for the sale of her animals. She has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years; she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in her life. 

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food.

loans.name: Victoria Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Victoria, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija, la cual es mayor de edad pero que aun vive en su casa y estudia Ing. Civil en una Universidad de Portoviejo. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.
 
Nuestra amiga trabaja en una guardería en la localidad, pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su lugar de trabajo, su hija por su parte también le ayuda con sus ventas ya que ella les vende a sus compañeros de clase y también cuando sale con ella a recorrer la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días ya que tiene sus dos actividades, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Portoviejo o en  Guayaquil cuando ella pueda viajar a esta ciudad. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde sus inicios y  le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hija termine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who know only work and dedication to family.

This is where we meet Victoria, age 46.  She is married, and they have one daughter.  Her daughter is an adult, but she still lives in Victoria’s house.  Her daughter is studying Civil Engineering at a university in Portoviejo.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Our friend works at a daycare in the area.  However, she also works selling all types of clothes.  She sells door-to-door, and she also sells at the place where she works.  Her daughter also helps her with her sales because she sells to her fellow students, and she goes with Victoria when she travels the city.

Victoria works every day because she has two business activities.  She gives credit to her customers, and she collects every eight days.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Portoviejo, or she goes to Guayaquil when she is able to travel to that city.  She has over ten years of experience at this business activity, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in her communal bank almost from the beginning.  She likes it because she used one of the loans to start her business.

Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase thread for embroidery.

loans.name: El Girasol 2 Group

texts.es:
Celia tiene 52 años y es originaria de Huemuchapa municipio de Tecoanapa, guerrero. Ella es casada felizmente con Saulo y el también es comerciante se ayudan entre si  por el trabajo que tienen, tienen Levid tiene 12 años cursa 6° de le primaria, Levi cursa 2° del bachiller.  

Celia se dedica a la venta de fríjol y Chiles verdes por la temporada que es en marzo y abril hasta mayo y después igual por su temporada vende Mandarina y Jicama, Celia al igual que su esposo tienen 32 años en su negocio lo cual piensan invertir su próximo préstamo en mas mercancía según la temporada como Elotes, Plátanos etc. Para poder poner un negocio estable, ya puede ser en un local o en su propia casa y evitar los pasajes, ya que les afecta no mucho pero si, en sus ganancias.
Celia es integrante del grupo Girasol 2 lo cual esta formado por 12 integrantes con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante por su familia quienes son: Celia, Edilberto, Olibia, M Rosa, Alfa, Apolonia, Rufina, Nayeli, Justina, Gilberto, Quirina, Oguida y se dedican ala venta de: Maíz, Pescados frescos y secos, Fríjol, Verduras y  Pollos
texts.en:
Celia, 52, is from the town of Huemuchapa in Tecoanapa, Guerrero.  She is happily married to Saulo who is also a merchant, and they help each in their work.  They have two children, Levid, 12, who is in 6th grade, and Levi, who is a sophomore in high school.

Celica sells beans and green chili peppers during the March, April, May season, and later in the year she sells tangerines and yam beans.  Celia and her husband have been in business for 32 years.  They plan to use the loan to buy more goods depending on the season, such as corn, bananas, etc., so they can establish a stable business, either in a shop or at home, to save on transportation, which affects their profits.

Celia is a member of the communal bank "Girasol "" which is comprised of 12 members who want to work and get ahead for their families.  The members are Celia, Edilberto, Olibia, M Rosa, Alfa, Apolonia, Rufina, Nayeli, Justina, Gilberto, Quirina, and Oguida, and they sell: corn, fresh and dried fish, beans, vegetables and chickens.

loans.use: To buy goods such as corn, bananas, yam beans, etc.

loans.name: Elena Nelly

texts.es:
